products.title: ALPHA PCD 3D Printer Nozzle – Polycrystalline Diamond (V6 / Prusa / K1C / K2P / Qidi Plus4)
products.body_html:
The ALPHA PCD nozzle represents a significant leap in 3D printing performance. Its polycrystalline diamond encapsulated insert delivers exceptional hardness at 5000 Vickers HV, substantially exceeding tungsten carbide, making it ideal for abrasive filaments and demanding materials. The nickel-plated copper body ensures superior thermal conductivity and heat distribution, while the ultra-low friction coefficient (0.01) minimises clogs and flow inconsistencies for reliable, uninterrupted printing. Engineered to handle extreme temperatures and material stress, the ALPHA nozzle extends nozzle life and maintains print quality across challenging applications. Compatible with V6, Prusa, K1C, K2P, and Qidi Plus4 systems.


Engineered For The Extremes

ALPHA nozzles feature an encapsulated polycrystalline diamond insert with a smooth nickel-plated copper body. This premium combination provides advantages over standard nozzles in thermal conductivity, hardness, maximum printing temperature, thermal expansion, and friction.

212% Harder Than Tungsten Carbide

For years, tungsten carbide has been regarded as the top choice material for abrasive material printing. Now, PCD is here to take the crown with a hardness of 5000 (Vickers HV), making the Alpha nozzle overqualified for printing the most demanding materials.

97.5% Less Friction Than Nickel

Clogs and inconsistent flow kill uptime. ALPHA combines the ultra-low friction coefficient of PCD (0.01) with an internal mirror-polished finish to help filament feed smoothly through the melt zone, reducing buildup and improving reliability.

30% Higher Heat Transfer Than Copper

Put heat where it matters most, right at the point filament exits the nozzle. With PCD thermal conductivity up to 500 W/m·K, ALPHA provides exceptional heat transfer, improving melt stability, flow consistency, and high-speed performance.

Key Product Specifications

  • Nozzle Material: Encapsulated PCD tip + Nickel-plated copper body
  • Filament Compatibility: All standard + highly abrasive filaments
  • Max Temperature: 500°C+ (ready for high-temp engineering materials)
  • Supported Form Factors: V6, Prusa, K1C, K2P, Qidi Plus4
  • Ideal Use Cases: High-speed printing, production workloads, abrasive filament printing

Material Comparison (Performance at a Glance)

Material Thermal Conductivity (W/m·K) Hardness (Vickers HV) Max Print Temp (°C) CTE (µm/m·°C) Friction
Brass 109 150 300 18 0.5
Copper 385 37 500 16.7 1.3
Hardened Steel 22 1000 450 8 0.4
Tungsten Carbide 100 1600 550 4.5 0.5
Ruby 35 2000 550 5.3 0.2
Silicon Carbide 170 2800 550 4 0.2
Polycrystalline Diamond (PCD) 500 5000 500+ 2.5 0.01


Warranty: 

Warranty information

products.body_html:
Precision soldering tip engineered for Miniware TS100 and TS101 irons or other iron with same tip standards such as Pinecil.

Constructed from stainless steel and red copper, this tip delivers superior thermal conductivity whilst maintaining durability under sustained high-temperature operation. Its compact profile enables finer control compared to conventional tips, making it ideal for detailed electronics assembly and repair. There is a range of size and tip style for most soldering application, each size are sold individually based on selection. 

Tips Size/Features: 

  • TS100 I Tip: A narrow long tip for small delicate jobs. 
  • TS100 K Tip: A large blade for jobs in tight spots.
  • TS100 KU Tip: A smaller version of the K tip. 
  • TS100 B2 Tip: The standard conical tip. 
  • TS100 D24 Tip: A small tip, like a flat-head screwdriver.
  • TS100 BC2 Tip: Cone-shaped with an angled flat tip.
  • TS100 C4 Tip: A large snub-nosed tip, for doing jobs with more solder.

products.title: E3D High Flow ObXidian® Creality K2 Plus Nozzles
products.body_html:
Engineered through an official E3D and Creality partnership, these ObXidian nozzles deliver high-flow performance tailored for K2 Plus and Hi 3D printers. The integrated all-metal design combines nozzle and HeatBreak into a single unit, maximising thermal stability whilst eliminating common failure points like thermal runaway and filament leakage. Tool-free installation means you'll swap nozzles in under five minutes, minimising downtime between print jobs and material changes.

Features: 

  • Drop-In for Creality K2 Series – Seamless upgrade for Creality K2 & K2 Plus; no mount or fan-duct changes required.
  • High-Flow, High-Speed – Custom internal geometry boosts heat transfer and volumetric flow for faster print times without sacrificing quality.
  • ObXidian Wear Resistance – Tool-steel insert with E3DLC™ coating delivers orders-of-magnitude higher durability for abrasive filaments like carbon fibre and glass fibre-filled materials.
  • Cleaner Nozzle, Cleaner Prints – Built-in non-stick properties reduce plastic build-up, improving surface finish and reducing maintenance.

Compatible Printer Hotends:

  • Creality K2 Plus
  • Creality Hi
  • Creality K2

products.body_html:

  • No warping: bed stays super flat at 120C as well as at 60C. No need to heatsink the bed for long time like aluminum beds.

  • Maximum bed temperature up to 130C compared to 105C stock bed.

What is Included:

General Note: You should never cut into AC heater pad. 

Note

  • To make sure the optimum performance for this heater is achievable, both temperature sensing and control elements should installed to controller.

Caution

  • The Heater Mat is not suitable for stand-alone operation.
  • Do not cut into the heater pad
  • Ensure proper strain relief on wiring and proper grounding of the cast bed.

Warning

  • These heaters shall only be used where adequate electrical, thermal and mechanical barriers are provided to prevent access to hazardous parts without the use of a tool.

Shipping Note: 

We ship items in a flat cardboard sandwich box to prevent warping during transit. This item cannot be combined with non-flat items for shipping, so please expect additional freight costs when bundling it with smaller parts or filament. If we can bundle smaller items within the same box, we will update the shipping total before processing your payment. Otherwise, feel free to contact support for a customised quote.

products.title: Micro Swiss FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality Hi
products.body_html:
The Micro Swiss FlowTech™ Hotend combines precision engineering with high-throughput capability, enabling print speeds up to 50 mm³/sec when paired with the Bondtech CHT High Flow Nozzle. Built for Creality Hi printers, this hotend maintains thermal stability and print quality even at elevated flow rates. Its straightforward installation requires no modifications, making it an accessible upgrade for users seeking faster production without sacrificing detail or reliability.

Made in USA by Microswiss

With genuine Bondtech CHT

Features:

  • Leak-Proof Nozzle:
    Tired of messy nozzle leaks that ruin your prints and waste filament? FlowTech Hotend combines nozzle and thermal break into one permanently sealed assembly that ensures a leak-proof hotend.

  • Cold Nozzle Change:
    Swapping out nozzles used to be a time-consuming and potentially hazardous task. With a FlowTech Hotend, nozzle changes are effortless, and there's no need for hot tightening, and you can do it with just one hand.

  • CHT High Flow Nozzle Performance:

    An official collaboration between Microswiss and Bondtech brings the CHT High Flow nozzle to the FlowTech ecosystem. This nozzle incorporates proprietary CHT technology, specifically engineered to boost the flow rate and improve layer adhesion.

    • High Flow CHT
      The FlowTech nozzle, equipped with Bondtech CHT technology, can achieve a maximum volumetric flow rate of up to 50 mm³/sec 
    • Better layer adhesion
      More uniform layer deposition is achieved by splitting the filament flow into multiple chambers as it passes through the melt zone. This reduces gaps and weak points between layers

  • All-Metal Design:
    Built to last. FlowTech’s fully all-metal construction handles most modern filaments with ease. Every unit is machined and assembled in-house, QC’d at multiple stages, and thermally cycled before packaging.

  • 300°C Max Temperature:
    This edition is precisely tuned for the Creality Hi with a matched NTC thermistor—no firmware changes needed. 

Printer Compatibility:

  • Creality Hi

What's in the box

  • 1x FlowTech™ Heater Core (24V - 100W)
  • 1x FlowTech™ CM2 CHT 0.4mm Nozzle
  • 1x Heatsink
  • 2x Titanium Screws
  • 1x Silicon Sock

Documentation:

  • Installation Instructions - PDF

products.title: LGX Shortcut Mosquito Hotend
products.body_html:
Designed With Flexibles In Mind

The LGX Shortcut Mosquito is a special hotend to be used with the LGX eXtruder.

Its main feature is a 23mm shorter filament path than the standard Mosquito.

With the LGX it forms a print head that will excel at printing ALL most common materials and especially the soft and flexible.

Each LGX Shortcut Copperhead™ Hotend is supplied with:

  • 1x LGX Black Anodized Aluminum Heat Sink
  • 1x LGX Black Anodized Aluminum Air Cooled Cold Block
  • 1x LGX Air-cooled Cold Block Mounting Hardware
  • 1x Mosquito hotend (Conduct version, without heatsink)
  • 1x Bondtech M6x1x7.5 Coated Brass Nozzle 0.4mm
  • 1x Silver Based Thermal Paste Sachet 0.5g

Designed To Be Flexible

The LGX Shortcut Mosquite Hotend includes a reversible heat sink that can be installed on the left or right hand side of the cold block. The heat sink also includes the hole pattern for attaching 40×40 fans.

Cooling down the heat break

Our tests suggest a 4010 fan is enough to cool down the cold block and the cold zone of the heat break, even with such small contact surface to the heat sink.

In case you have an application where additional cooling is required, try using a 4020 fan or 2 LGX heat sinks, one on each side.

Main Advantages

  • Robust hotend
  • One hand nozzle swap
  • Gives better access to softer materials.
  • Enables to print flexible and soft materials faster.
  • Keeps the print-head small and light.
  • Allows mounting in many different ways.

Compatibility Alerts

The LGX Shortcut Mosquito Hotend is not compatible with the following items:

    • 3DSolex Matchless 1.75mm nozzles.

Compatible nozzles

The hot block included in this product is compatible with the RepRap standard of nozzles. Below is a list of compatible versions.
Click each link to open the related product page.

  • From Bondtech
    • CHT Coated Brass
  • From Slice Engineering
    • Vanadium Steel (for abrasive filaments)
  • From E3D
    • Whole Collection

Technical Specification

LGX Shortcut Mosquito Hotend
  • Cold Block Material : Anodized Aluminum;
  • Heat Sink Material : Anodized Aluminum;
  • Mosquito Hot Block materials : steel tube; copper body; nickel plating.
  • Max operating (nozzle) temperature : 450°C
  • Max tightening torque on the extruder screws is 0.3 Nm
  • Max tightening torque on the heatsink/cold block screw is 0.6 Nm
  • LGX Shortcut Mosquito hotend net weight : 61 g
  • Package measurements : 80x103x73 mm
  • Package weight : 105 g

products.title: BIQU Panda Breath V1.0
products.body_html:
With the BIQU Panda Breath, you can take the temperature, air quality, and material conditioning of your 3D printer to a whole new level! This system combines active chamber heating, intelligent control, and powerful air filtration into one compact unit—ideal for demanding materials and clean printing environments.

Active Chamber Heating to Combat Warping

The integrated 300 W PTC heater warms the build chamber quickly and evenly. This significantly reduces warping and cracking while improving layer adhesion, especially with technical filaments such as ABS, ASA, PC, or PA. At the same time, you'll benefit from a reliable, clean first layer even when using standard materials.

Intelligent Automatic Operation

Panda Breath permanently monitors the heatbed temperature and controls both heating and air filtration fully automatically. Simply define your desired temperature thresholds via the web interface - and the system handles the rest. No manual switching or constant readjustment required.

Heating and Filtration in Perfect Sync

As soon as the heatbed reaches your preset temperature, Panda Breath starts automatically. The chamber is heated, and air purification is activated precisely when it is needed most.

Active Air Purification for a Clean Environment

The two-stage filtration system, consisting of a HEPA filter and activated carbon, draws air directly from the chamber, reliably filtering out fine dust and VOCs (Volatile Organic Compounds) before releasing purified, warmed air back in. The result: significantly fewer odours and a noticeably more pleasant room climate.

Integrated Filament Drying

Panda Breath is more than just a chamber heater; it also functions as a filament dryer. When your printer is in standby, you can easily switch to drying mode to remove moisture from your filament without the need for additional devices or extra space.

Safe for Continuous Operation

Multi-stage hardware and software protection mechanisms reliably prevent overheating. The system has been intensively tested on various printer models and consistently maintains the chamber temperature within safe limits.

Robust Construction

The fully grounded metal housing with a heat-resistant powder coating ensures stability, durability, and a clean, industrial look. It is built for long-term, heavy-duty use.

Wireless Control via Web Interface

Control all functions conveniently and wirelessly: set temperature limits, activate heating, or turn on drying mode. Regular firmware updates ensure that your Panda Breath will continue to receive new features in the future.

Wide Compatibility

Panda Breath is fully compatible with the P1S, P1P, and X1C. In combination with the Panda Shelter, the system can also be used with the A1.

Documentation:

https://global.bttwiki.com/Panda_Breath.html

What is Included (Panda Breathe):

  • 1 x BIQU Panda Breath
  • 1 x mains cable (250 V, 10 A, 0.3 m, C14 to C13 + C13)
  • 2 x thermal insulation mats made from aluminium foil
  • 2 x cable clips
  • 1 x Allen key, 2.5 mm
  • 1 x M3 flange nut

  • 1 x M3x8 countersunk tapping screw

What is Included (Panda Breath Filter Pack):

Compatibility (materials) ABS, ASA, PC, PA-CF, PAHT-CF, PET-CF, PPA-CF, PPS, PPS-CF, etc.
Heating power 300 W
Input voltage 100-240 V AC

products.title: Phaetus aeFlex™ TPU Aero Filament 1kg
products.body_html:
Phaetus aeFlex™ TPU-Aero represents a breakthrough in flexible filament engineering, delivering a foaming TPU compound that dynamically adjusts its shore hardness based on hotend temperature. Print at lower temperatures to achieve shore 82A rigidity for structural components, or increase heat to reach shore 66A softness for impact-absorbing applications—all from a single spool. This temperature-responsive behaviour eliminates the need for multiple material stocks whilst maintaining consistent print quality across diverse use cases. The aero-optimised formulation ensures reliable extrusion, minimal stringing, and excellent layer adhesion. Ideal for engineers and makers requiring flexible parts with tunable mechanical properties, from protective enclosures to vibration-dampening mounts. Each 1kg spool delivers professional-grade performance for demanding prototyping and production runs.

Printing Settings

Additional Information: https://github.com/Phaetus/aeFlex-TPU-AERO

A wear resistant nozzle must be used, addictive in this material is abrasive and will wear standard brass nozzles and >0.5mm nozzle is recommended.

For best results, dry filament using a filament drier before use or print from dryer running or dry box. Keep in an airtight container or included mylar bag for medium/long term storage with silica desiccant. [If you hear popping or inconsistent extrusion while purging filament, suggest drying before printing for best results] Filament Drying Guide

 

Nozzle Temperature 230°C - 270°C
Build Plate Temperature 30°C - 45°C
Build Surface Material Works well with most common build surfaces. We recommended PEI Build Plate (Smooth/Texture suitable)
Build Surface Treatment Typically none required. Some surfaces such as glass work best with PVA glue stick or Magigoo .
Enclosure / Heater Chambers

None
Cooling Fan On
Printing Speed < 150 mm/s
Retraction

The ideal retraction settings vary from printer to printer. If you find the retraction settings are causing gaps in your part, the following settings may help.

Manufacturer Recommendation is no retraction 
Drying Recommendation  ~50°c for 4-6hrs (Only dry if filament is wet, over drying/repeat drying can damage filament)  (Filament Dryer Guide)
Storage Keeping filament in an airtight container with new/dried desiccant.

Based on 0.6 mm nozzle. Printing conditions may vary with different printers and nozzle diameters.

Datasheet:  

  • Datasheet

products.title: Phaetus aeWorthy™ ASA AERO Filament 1kg
products.body_html:
aeWorthy™ ASA-Aero is a type of light weight 3D printing material specially developed for aircraft model, ship model, drone and other fields. It can be controlled the foaming ratio by adjusting the temperature during the printing process, so that the density of the material extruded by the nozzle can be adjusted within a certain range. With this technique, it is easy to reduce the weight of the prints. In the best-case scenario, the prints weight can be reduced to 50% of a prints in ordinary ASA. In addition to that, the matte texture of the prints’ surface can reduce the visibility of printed layers and thus gives a smooth surface finish.

Printing Settings

Additional Information: https://github.com/Phaetus/aeWorthy-ASA-AERO

A wear resistant nozzle must be used, addictive in this material is abrasive and will wear standard brass nozzles and >0.5mm nozzle is recommended.

For best results, dry filament using a filament drier before use or print from dryer running or dry box. Keep in an airtight container or included mylar bag for medium/long term storage with silica desiccant. [If you hear popping or inconsistent extrusion while purging filament, suggest drying before printing for best results] Filament Drying Guide

 

Nozzle Temperature 240°C - 280°C
Build Plate Temperature 80°C - 110°C
Build Surface Material Works well with most common build surfaces. We recommended PEI Build Plate (Smooth/Texture suitable)
Build Surface Treatment Typically none required. Some surfaces such as glass work best with PVA glue stick or Magigoo .
Enclosure / Heater Chambers

At minimal passive enclosure. 
60-80˚C+ may be required for higher density and larger geometries.

Recommend VOC/Air Filtering/fume extraction or print in well ventilated room with fume extraction. 
Cooling Fan LOW for better surface quality
OFF for better strength
Printing Speed 30 mm/s - 90 mm/s
Retraction The ideal retraction settings vary from printer to printer. If you find the retraction settings are causing gaps in your part, the following settings may help.
Direct Drive: Retraction distance of 0.5 - 1mm with retraction speed of 20mm/s
Bowden: Retraction distance of 2 - 3mm with retraction speed of 20 - 40mm/s
Drying Recommendation  ~50°c for 4-6hrs (Only dry if filament is wet, over drying/repeat drying can damage filament)  (Filament Dryer Guide)
Storage Keeping filament in an airtight container with new/dried desiccant.

Based on 0.6 mm nozzle. Printing conditions may vary with different printers and nozzle diameters.

Datasheet:  

  • Datasheet

products.title: Fysetc Hardened Steel Extruder Gear for Anycubic Kobra 3
products.body_html:
Hardened steel extruder gear designed for the Anycubic Kobra 3. Features CNC nano coating for durability and reliable filament drive. Direct replacement part compatible with Anycubic 3D printers.

What is Included:

  • 1x Fysetc Hardened Steel Extruder Gear Assembly

Compatibility:

  • For Anycubic Kobra 3

Features:

  • The integrated shaft design ensures better eccentricity of the gears, reduces eccentric rotation of the gears due to assembly, and ensures that the gears transport filament more evenly.
  • Helical gear design, better meshing performance, smoother gear transmission, and more linear transmission force. The transmission overlap is large, the meshing time is long, and the contact area is large, which reduces the stress, thereby improving the load-bearing capacity of the gear and extending the service life of the gear.
  • Use high-strength mold steel as the material of the feeding gear, and use nano-coating for surface treatment. The overall Rockwell hardness HRC value of the gear reaches 62-65; the surface hardness HV 1000-1200.

products.title: Fysetc Hexa Distro Fusion Board (USB2517 with CAN 2.0)
products.body_html:
The HEXA DISTRO FUSION consolidates power distribution and peripheral control into a single interface for toolchanger systems. Six independent CANBUS or USB channels enable daisy-chained device communication, while six USB 2.0 ports handle simultaneous connections. Each of the six DC outputs delivers 7.5A, supporting fans, RGB strips, proximity sensors, and Hall-effect switches without auxiliary controllers. Flexible IO configuration adapts to mixed peripheral types, streamlining wiring complexity and reducing board count in multi-tool setups.


Features

  • 6 x USB2.0 based on USB2517
  • 6 x CAN 2.0 connectors based on STM32F072CB
  • 6 x 24V 7.5A Max power distribution with 2 controllable methods
  • 4 x ADC input, for ADC sensors such as thermistors.
  • 8 x general IO
  • 6 x 24V max I/O with power control for RGB/FAN/Proximity switches, etc.
  • Onboard 24V to 5V@3A DC-DC circuit
  • USB working status LED indicators
  • Onboard RESET and BOOT0 buttons for easy firmware update

Documentation:

  • Hexa Distro | Documentation
  • Hexa Wiki

products.title: Cartographer Probe v4 - CAN & USB
products.body_html:
Introducing the Cartographer Probe v4: The Ultimate Eddy Current Displacement Sensor for 3D Printers

Note - board are pre-flashed with USB Firmware, so you may have to re-flash yourself to suit your installation if you wish to use in CAN mode, instructions on how to do this are available at cartographer3d documentation site https://docs.cartographer3d.com

What is new? 

Cartographer V4 not only introduces a new All in One Design, but improved thermal and electrical reliability. 

  • Faster and more powerful MCU Rated to 125oC*
  • Simple and Reliable All in One Design**
  • Increased Accuracy with refined coil routing and design 
  • Updated and Improved USB Cable
  • No more bridging pads for DFU mode (we gave you holes)

* Although most components are rated up to 125C, we do not recommend going above 110C ambient temperature. 

** Please note, Cartographer design is slightly different to Cartographer competitor's H variety, please check the CAD. V4 is compatible with a majority of Cartographer V3 mounts. 

This latest version allows for you to switch between using either CAN or USB via Firmware, no need to re-solder anything.

Cartographer and CAN

CAN provides easy and simple wiring, no need to run multiple wires from your MCU, or use one of your limited number of USB ports, just tap into your Toolheads CAN ouput, and enjoy a seemless setup. 

It is recommended to run your CAN network at a baudrate of 1,000,000. 

Input Shaping (adxl345)

The probes proximity to your printers nozzle, the adxl345 provides a higher level of accuracy when running input shaper than motor mounted alternatives. 

Specification:

  • MCU: stm32g431
  • Connectivity: CAN & USB via 4 pin Genuine Molex Sherlock connector.
  • Firmware Requirement: Klipper
  • Temperature Rating: It is recommended to operate Cartographer v4 in no higher than 110C, many components are rated higher than that. 

The only component not rated for high temperature is the ADXL345, this was a choice to keep the price down, we have observed no issues running ADXL345 at higher temperatures, though we don't recommend relying on it for input shaping after prolonged use over 85. 

What is included?

  • 1 x Cartographer Probe V4
  • 1 x 1.8m USB Cable (USB-A to Genuine Molex Sherlock)
  • 1 x 18cm CAN Cable (DuPont to Genuine Molex Sherlock)
  • 1 x Silicone Nozzle Brush
  • 1 x Cartographer V4 Fastener Pack

Which version should I buy? 

  • Standard Edition - Ideal for Voron StealthBurner, Annex etc 
  • Low Profile Edition - Perfect for VzBot and RatRig Printer

Currently Cartographer do not support delta printers.

products.body_html:

*All timelines above are our best estimate and do not guarantee an arrival time, until order has arrive and pass local customs.

Discover the Rook MK1 3D Printer Kit by Rolohaun

Embark on a thrilling journey of creativity and innovation with the Rook MK1 3D Printer Kit. Designed for enthusiasts and newcomers alike, this printer is not just a tool but an experience that combines speed, precision, and the joy of building your own machine.

Key Features:

  • High Speed CoreXY Design: The Rook MK1 leverages a CoreXY architecture to achieve exceptional printing speeds of 150~200mm/s, ensuring quick and efficient production of your 3D models.
  • Compatible with Popular Filaments: This open-air printer excels with widely used filaments such as PLA and PETG, making it perfect for a variety of projects.
  • Complete DIY Experience: The kit includes all necessary hardware and wiring, transforming the assembly process into a delightful weekend project that you can share with friends and family.
  • Comprehensive Build Support: Access a wealth of resources, including a detailed build guide and community-driven modifications available on GitHub.
  • Expansion Options: While the default kit does not include printed parts, you have the option to purchase them separately for enhanced customization.

What’s Included:

  • All essential components and hardware for assembly
  • Electronics featuring the BTT M4P motherboard with TMC2209 stepper drivers
  • Aluminum build plate and heating solutions for optimal performance
  • Detailed list of motor kits and other vital parts to ensure smooth operation

Specifications:

  • Printing Size: 110x110x110mm
  • Max Bed Temperature: 110ºC
  • External Dimensions: 220x275x370mm after assembly
  • Weight: Gross 5.5Kg/Kit

Why Choose the Rook MK1?

Not only does the Rook MK1 3D Printer Kit offer an engaging assembly process, but it also fosters a vibrant community of modders and innovators. With the support of Rolohaun and fellow users, you have the opportunity to enhance your machine and share ideas, making every project an adventure.

Prepare for the ultimate DIY experience and unleash your creative potential with the Rook MK1 3D Printer Kit. Reserve yours today and step into the world of 3D printing!

 See a build guide by Kanrog87 here if you need inspiration!

To learn more about the Rook, check out the GitHub - all STLs can be found here. We recommend also checking out some community mods, especially some of the ones created by Gulsifer. 

A special thanks to Rolohaun, who both designed and created the Rook as well as fostered a community of modders and innovators who have taken the designs to the next level.

products.title: *Pre-Order* LDO Voron SwitchWire Kit Rev C Printer Kit
products.body_html:
PRE-ORDER 2.4r2 Rev C 300

Pre-Order - Special Order - Contact Us

All timelines above are our best estimate and do not guarantee an arrival time, until order has arrive and pass local customs.

Does NOT include the 3D printed parts/PIF Service

Features in Rev C:

  • Stealthburner toolhead.
  • New Nitehawk USB tooboard for easy wiring. (Nitehawk is brand name for USB toolboard developed by LDO, tested by Voron team)
  • E3D Voron Revo Hotend LDO Edition.
  • BigTreeTech SKR mini E3 V3.0 mainboard.
  • 4.3inch Capacitive Touch Screen.
  • Raspberry Pi 4B included as Standard.

SwitchWire Kit Printer Kit by LDO.

  1. If you have never touched a 3D printer before, We recommenced DO NOT buy this kit.
  2. This is a significant project to undertake. DC electronics, advanced 3D printer knowledge is recommended. It is assumed you know how to crimp cables, own a crimper, and have sourced/printed the required 3D Parts to complete the build. Experienced Voron builders take 25-30 hours to complete a build. It's not uncommon for first-time builders to be taking 50-60 hours before everything is complete and ready to print.
  3. It is recommended you read the assembly manual in completion before committing to purchase and build a kit.
  4. Read our Voron Buying Guide. In completion & note that we do  provide technical / building support via phone via apportionment and answer questions/support via email & discord.

Features & Extras

  • Stainless Steel Linear Rails - That's right, no more worrying about rusty rails. Remember to properly lubricate your linear rails!
  • Toolhead PCB - Our kit includes a modified hartk toolhead PCB. In addition, we designed a toolhead breakout PCB to make wiring at the controller end simple and straightforward.
  • Brass Heatset Insert Tool - We've included a custom machined brass tip for your soldering iron, use it to install heatset inserts with ease! Check here for more information.
  • Input Shaper Tool- We thew in a toolkit that includes all the necessary parts to help you perform input shaper calibration, hassle free.
  • Pre-cut & Pre-wired - Our kit includes all necessary wiring: cut to just the right length and pre-crimped or soldered to their respective parts. See our supplementary wiring guide here.
  • Small Tools - We include a small set of hex wrenches for all the fasteners used in the build (including a bunch of 1.5mm hex wrenches which wear out easily). However, you should definitely still buy a set of good quality hex wrenches. Also included is a small flat head screw driver that is useful in a surprising numerous situations.
  • 2mm Drill Bit - Metric drill bits may not be very common in some parts of the world, so we included one. Use it to ream the filament path in your printed extruder parts.

Tips

  • Take advantage of the Voron on Discord: https://discord.gg/voron. The community is very active on Discord and the users are very helpful on the #voron_switchwire_questions channel.
  • Since printed parts are NOT included with the kit, it is recommended get them from through the Voron Print It Forward program if you are unable to print them for yourself.  They will provide the essential parts for a very reasonable cost to get your printer working.
  • Download Fusion 360 and get a free license to view the 3D model of the printer. The 3D model is a very useful reference when you encounter anything in the manual that is ambiguous or unclear.
  • Check out Nero 3D's Youtube channel, he has tons of videos on assembling Voron printers.
  • Handle the Keybak with care! It has a tendency to retract violently whenever your eyeballs are near it.
  • Print a Voron Cube, then print a Steppy!
  • Get a serial number once you finish building your Voron.

Guides

  • Printed Parts Guide (LDO supplement) - Are you planning on printing parts before the kit arrives? Read our supplementary print guide to see which parts to print/replace/omit.
  • Wiring Guide - We created this supplementary wiring guide to go along with the included cable kit. We recommend reading the guide ahead of time: Some cable routing is required while you assemble the mechanical components.
  • Tuning Guide - We highly recommend reading over this very detailed tuning guide by Ellis to help print out the best possible looking parts.
  • Cable Chain Guide - See our short guide here for tips on our included cable chains (also known as drag chains).

Acknowledgements

Our team at LDO would like to give our heartfelt thanks to the Voron team, beta testers, and members of the community for helping us constantly improve our kits:

  • Beta Kit Testers: Steve, hartk, dunar, 120decibell.
  • Manual Additions: dunar


More Info: https://docs.ldomotors.com/voron/voronsw

Full Bom : https://docs.ldomotors.com/en/voron/voronsw/bom

products.title: High Flow ObXiDian® 500 Complete HotEnd for Bambu Lab H2D, H2C, H2S
products.body_html:
Powered by brand new ObXiDian® 500 technology, these premium HotEnds are an official collaboration between E3D and Bambu Lab. The unique coating on the nozzles makes them at least 5 times more wear resistant than E3D popular ObXidian range!

Users will get exceptional wear-resistance that effortlessly outshines other hardened nozzles. This long-lasting, simple upgrade allows you to easily achieve pristine prints with ANY filament over and over again! E3D are very proud to be the only officially approved manufacturer of after market Bambu Lab HotEnds.

  • The innovative 4 channel internal nozzle modification of this HotEnd significantly improves heat transfer through the filament and allows you to boost your volumetric flow rate by over 60%! That means you can expect more reliable and consistent extrusion at the same speeds or bump up the volumetric flow rate limit in the slicer to utilise the motion systems' capabilities fully.
  • High-speed printing often sacrifices visual and functional aspects in favour of speed but these HotEnds maintain interlayer adhesion strength even at higher speeds; resulting in the perfect filament finish and strong parts for functional applications. 
  • Most abrasive materials simply won’t wear an ObXiDian 500 nozzle. Upgrade so you can print with any filament you like (including UV-reactive/ “glow in the dark” filaments) without endless maintenance.
  • E3D ObXiDian 500 technology significantly extends nozzle life by making the primary wear points on the nozzle several orders of magnitude more wear-resistant than other steel nozzles on the market. Better for your pocket, and the planet.
  • The state-of-the-art coating applied to the nozzle has a low surface energy to prevent filament build-up. This makes it easier to clean the nozzle between prints and also drastically reduces the likelihood of print crashes and cosmetic defects in your prints.

Compatibility Printers:

  • Bambu Lab H2D
  • Bambu Lab H2S
  • Bambu Lab H2C (Not compatible with Induction hot swappable hotend) 

Includes:

  • 1 x Assembled High Flow ObXiDian® 500 HotEnd for Bambu Lab H2D, H2S 0.40 mm or 0.60 mm

Documentation:

Install Guide: https://e3d-online.com/pages/bambu-lab-support-h2-p2-high-flow-obxidian-500-hotend

Print Profile: https://makerworld.com/en/models/1842294-e3d-a1-a1-mini-high-flow-obxidian-profiles

ObXiDian 500 nozzles are exceptionally wear resistant compared to other products on the market and significantly outperform other hardened nozzles. Improvements in ‘exotic’ engineering filaments mean that some new materials which include aggressive fillers, including but not limited to Polymaker’s Fiberon range, can cause significant wear on even ObXiDian 500 nozzles. E3D is actively developing even more specialist solutions for these materials. In the meantime please be aware that your ObXiDian 500 nozzle will not be everlasting under extreme material conditions. 

Some filled materials contain particles that are close to, if not larger than, some of the smaller industry standard nozzle sizes, including up to 0.4mm. Attempting to print such materials through these nozzle sizes significantly increases the risk of a jam. Please check your filament manufacturer’s datasheet for recommended minimum nozzle orifice diameter to ensure that the nozzle/HotEnd you choose is suitable for your use case. 

Product History:

Order after 25th February 2026 will be shipping newer version which fixed the magnet orientation for P2S. 

FAQs

Will the high flow products actually reduce my print time?
Print time reduction is affected by many variables, including the part you are wanting to print. In most cases using E3D premade slicer profiles you should see a decrease in print time – however if you are printing very small, detailed models with little to no infill you may not see a dramatic decrease in print time as we prioritise maintaining high visual quality in the outside perimeters.

Will the nozzle ever wear?
Yes, given enough time the nozzle may exhibit wear, but will do so considerably slower than a Hardened Steel nozzle. Expected product life is difficult to quantify due to the numerous variables involved, including base polymer, additive, brand, temperature, and print speed.

Does this void my warranty with my printer?
No, Bambu Lab have collaborated with E3D throughout the development and has officially approved the use of these products.

Can I still print with normal filament like PLA?
Absolutely! Even using the standard print profiles, you will notice more consistent visual consistency due to improved thermal performance and flow boosting of the high flow variants, enabling you to have stronger, better-looking parts.

What’s the benefit of this product if my printer doesn’t actually reach 500°C?
You will always be restricted by the maximum printing temperature of your machine. For a H2D/H2C/H2S printer that is 350°C, and for P2S that is 300°C. However, even printing at lower temperatures you will still get all the other benefits of the product such as the extreme abrasion resistance which enhances longevity, and the non-stick coating on the nozzle which makes it easier to clean and reduces plastic build-up/print defects.

products.title: Polymaker Fiberon™ PA6-CF20 (Formerly PolyMide™ PA6-CF)
products.body_html:
Polymaker Fiberon™ PA6-CF20 sets new standards in terms of strength and durability. Reinforced with 20% carbon fibre, it brings outstanding stiffness, stability and heat resistance to your 3D printing projects. Fiber Adhesion™ technology ensures excellent layer adhesion and makes PA6-CF20 the perfect choice for applications that require maximum durability.

Thanks to heat resistance of up to 215 °C and extreme durability, PA6-CF20 outperforms almost any other printing material. It is ideal for functional components that are subject to heavy use.

Outstanding Performance Features

  • Exceptional Strength & Stiffness: Tensile strength up to 109 MPa and Youngs modulus over 8.6 GPa (XY), providing robust, rigid parts.[1]
  • High Heat Resistance: Withstands temperatures up to 215°C after annealing[2], suitable for parts exposed to high thermal loads.
  • Superior Layer Adhesion: Fiber Adhesion™ technology ensures strong interlayer bonding and cohesive, durable prints.
  • Dimensional Stability: Minimal warping and excellent size stability, even on large or complex prints.
  • Chemical Resistance: Suitable for use in chemically aggressive environments.
  • Improved Printability – Unlike many other Nylon filaments, Fiberon™ PA6-CF20 is extremely easy to work with, exhibiting excellent dimensional stability. It is compatible with most filament-based 3D printers with no heated bed or chamber required!

Easy to Print for Advanced Users
While engineered for high performance, Fiberon™ PA6-CF20 is optimized for reliable printing on advanced FDM/FFF 3D printers equipped with an all-metal hotend and a hardened nozzle due to the abrasive carbon fiber content. Filament drying and post-print annealing are recommended for best results.

Same Trusted Formula, New Name
Fiberon™ PA6-CF20 is the same proven formula as PolyMide™ PA6-CF, though it may print in a slightly darker black shade than its predecessor.

Choose Fiberon™ PA6-CF20 for parts that demand maximum strength, heat resistance, and durability in industrial and engineering environments.

Fiberon™ PA6-CF20 is the same great formula as PolyMide PA6-CF, although Fiberon™ PA6-CF20 may print in a slightly darker black shade color than its predecessor.

[1] Most Nylon parts in the real world undergo a process called "Moisture conditioning" which improves toughness and flexibility of the Nylon while reducing tensile strength and stiffness. Unless protected with a moisture barrier, PA6-CF shows a greater change in mechanical properties when subjected to water / high humidity in comparison to long-chain nylon filaments like PA12-CF or PA612-CF. In simple terms PA6-CF will typically offer the best properties in a dry application, but for a wet or high humidity application a longer chain nylon such as PA612 or PA12 may be better. 
[2] Fiberon™ PA6-CF20 displays the best mechanical and thermal properties when fully crystallized. The printed part will not reach full crystallisation during the printing process, an additional step is required: Annealing. Fiberon™ PA6-CF20 can be annealed in the oven at 100˚C for 16 hours right after the printing process.

products.title: Micro Swiss FlowTech™ Hotend for Elegoo Centauri Carbon
products.body_html:
Microswiss FlowTech Hotend is engineered for speed and reliability. Paired with Bondtech CHT High Flow Nozzle, this setup delivers up to 50 mm³/sec for ultra-fast printing without sacrificing quality. Installation is truly plug-and-play for the Elegoo Centauri Carbon, drop it in and start printing.

Made in USA by Microswiss

With genuine Bondtech CHT


Features:

  • Leak-Proof Nozzle:
    Tired of messy nozzle leaks that ruin your prints and waste filament? FlowTech Hotend combines nozzle and thermal break into one permanently sealed assembly that ensures a leak-proof hotend.

  • Cold Nozzle Change:
    Swapping out nozzles used to be a time-consuming and potentially hazardous task. With a FlowTech Hotend, nozzle changes are effortless, and there's no need for hot tightening, and you can do it with just one hand.

  • CHT High Flow Nozzle Performance:

    An official collaboration between Microswiss and Bondtech brings the CHT High Flow nozzle to the FlowTech ecosystem. This nozzle incorporates proprietary CHT technology, specifically engineered to boost the flow rate and improve layer adhesion.

    • High Flow CHT
      The FlowTech nozzle, equipped with Bondtech CHT technology, can achieve a maximum volumetric flow rate of up to 50 mm³/sec.
    • Better layer adhesion
      CHT splits the filament path into multiple chambers within the melt zone for more uniform deposition, reducing gaps and weak points.

  • All-Metal Design:
    Built to last. FlowTech’s fully all-metal construction handles most modern filaments with ease. Every unit is machined and assembled in-house, QC’d at multiple stages, and thermally cycled before packaging.

  • 300°C Max Temperature:
    This edition is precisely tuned for the Elegoo Centauri Carbon with a matched NTC thermistor—no firmware changes needed. Rated for printing up to 300 °C.

Compatibility:

  • Elegoo Centauri Carbon

What is Included:

  • 1x FlowTech™ Heater Core (24V - 60W)
  • 1x FlowTech™ CM2 CHT 0.4mm Nozzle
  • 1x Heatsink
  • 2x Titanium Screws
  • 1x Silicon Sock

Documentation: 

Installation Instructions - PDF

products.title: Ambrosia PLA Filament 1.75mm 1kg
products.body_html:
Ambrosia Filament's line of PLA filament is derived from 100% Virgin Grade-A Non-Toxic pellets from West3D. Manufactured to a tighter than standard tolerance (+/- 0.03mm) you'll experience consistent extrusion throughout the spool. Free of additives, this filament prints like butter. 

Note: Star Dust is Sparkle Version, while Easter Egg is standard PLA

Materials Features/Applications

  • High quality PLA
  • Derived from 100% Virgin (Grade-A) non-toxic pellets

You can see our other ASA Filament as we only plan to stock unique colour from West3D. 

Materials/Spool/Packaging Information: 

  • Cardboard spool and packaging
  • Vacuum sealed bag with an additional re-usable mylar bag
  • Diameter: 1.75mm (+/- 0.05mm)
  • Net weight: 1KG
  • Density: 1.25 g/cm3

  • Empty Cardboard Spool: ~145g

This spool does fit in the A1 / X1 / AMS / AMS Lite / Creality CFS / Anycubic Ace system. Cardboard Plastic Spool Ring for Bambu Lab AMS: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000342355-dremc-filament-snap-on-addon 

The glue holding the filament spool together is rated for an environment of 70C (158F). If using a filament dryer or require the filament spool by placed in an environment exceeding this temperature, we recommend printing a spool clip (here).

Printing Settings

For best results, dry filament using a filament drier before use or print from dryer running or dry box. Keep in an airtight container or included mylar bag for medium/long term storage with silica desiccant. [If you hear popping or inconsistent extrusion while purging filament, suggest drying before printing for best results] Filament Drying Guide.

Print Profile Example: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000343310-dremc-filament-3d-printing-profile

Brittle Materials Guide: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000492353-print-tip-brittle-materials-carbon-fibre-glass-fibre-sparkle-glow-in-dark-

Nozzle Temperature 190°C - 220°C 
Build Plate Temperature 0°C - 65°C
Build Surface Material Works well with most common build surfaces. We recommended PEI Build Plate (Texture suitable), smooth with PVA/Bed Adhesive such as Magigoo.
Build Surface Treatment Typically none required. Some surfaces such as glass work best with PVA glue stick or Magigoo.
Cooling Fan On (50-100%) range varies by cooling capabilities
Enclosure / Heater Chambers

Not Required (15-40C [25C])
Printing Speed 30 mm/s - 150 mm/s
Retraction The ideal retraction settings vary from printer to printer. If you find the retraction settings are causing gaps in your part, the following settings may help.
Direct Drive: Retraction distance of 0.5 - 1mm with retraction speed of 20mm/s
Bowden: Retraction distance of 2 - 3mm with retraction speed of 20 - 40mm/s
Drying Recommendation  ~50°c for 4-6hr (Only dry if filament is wet, over drying/repeat drying can damage filament) (Filament Dryer Guide)
Storage Keeping filament in an airtight container or provided Mylar bag with new/dried desiccant. 
Support Material

Single Extrusion:
Self Support

Idex/Tool Changer:
DREMC PVA

Note: Due to the low co-efficient of friction please ensure you have smooth filament path from filament box/dryer. We recommended 3x4mm PTFE to be used for reverse bowden.  

Based on 0.5/0.6 mm nozzle. Printing conditions may vary with different printers and nozzle diameters.

Spool Size:

  • Spool Diameter: 198mm (+/-1mm)
  • Spool Hub Diameter: 53mm (+/-1mm)
  • Spool Width: 65mm (+/-4mm)

Technical Specifications for AMBROSIA ASA Filament:

Ambrosia Filament provides no warranty and assumes no responsibility or liability for the information contained and expressly disclaims that the information is a representation or guarantee of the specifications, properties, or health and safety data.

 Physical Properties Test Methodology Values
Density ISO1183 1.25-1.26 g/cm^3
Melt Flow Rate (250C/2.16KG) ISO 1133 4-8 g/10min
Mechanical Properties Test Methodology Values
Tensile Strength ISO 527 45-49 Mpa
Elongation at break ISO 527 13-15.5%
Flexural Modulus ISO 527 1000-1100 Mpa
Flexural Strength ISO 178 69-75 Mpa
Impact Strength ISO 180 4.5-5 KJ/m^2
Thermal Dynamic Properties Test Methodology Values
HDT@ 0.455 MPa(66 psi) ISO 75 53C

products.title: Polymaker Fiberon™ PPS-GF20 Grey 500g 1.75 mm
products.body_html:
Polymaker's Fiberon™ PPS-GF20 combines polyphenylene sulfide with 20% glass fibre reinforcement to deliver exceptional thermal stability, dimensional accuracy, and electrical insulation properties. Engineered for demanding applications in electronics, aerospace, and industrial sectors, this 500g spool of 1.75mm filament meets the rigorous requirements of professionals seeking superior performance and reliability in their 3D-printed components.

  • High performance PPS-GF with 20% glass fiber reinforcement.
  • Electrical insulation perfect for electronic housings and ADAS sensor enclosures.
  • Flame retardant (UL94 V0) and exceptional chemical resistance
  • Extreme heat resistance up to 236°C HDT after annealing.
  • High bending modulus and tensile strength.
  • Low moisture sensitivity for humidity or wet applications.
  • Reliable and consistent tolerance (1.75mm diameter +/- 0.03mm)

Why choose PPS-GF20

  • Fiberon PPS-GF20 offers 6.05 kV/mm dielectric strength and a low dielectric constant (2.71 @ 1MHz), making it perfect for electrical housings, ADAS sensor enclosures, and structural components in 5G base stations.
  • Engineered to maintain structural integrity in temperatures up to 236.3 °C (HDT @ 0.45 MPa after annealing). Whether you're building parts for high-temp enclosures, hot-air equipment, or vehicle under-hood use, this filament won’t warp under pressure.
  • With 20% glass fiber reinforcement, PPS-GF20 delivers exceptional strength and stiffness—up to 4552 MPa Young’s modulus and 102 MPa bending strength in XY—ideal for brackets, antenna mounts, and chemically exposed parts.
  • UL94 V0 certified at 1.5mm and resistant to acids, bases, oils, and solvents. A trusted option for mission-critical environments such as chemical labs, factory floors, and automotive housings.
  • Supports high-speed printing (up to 250 mm/s) with minimal warping and stable Z-axis strength. Recommended for hardened steel nozzles. Available in neutral gray for reduced heat absorption and post-processing flexibility.
  • Delivered vacuum-sealed and neatly wound, this filament is compatible with Bambu AMS systems. Low moisture absorption (0.11%， 70%RH, 23°C) ensures reliable print quality, even in humid environments.

products.title: Polymaker Fiberon™ PA612-ESD 500g 1.75mm
products.body_html:
Fiberon™ PA612-ESD merges nylon's strength and thermal stability with static-dissipative features, enabling the production of ESD-safe components such as housings, jigs, and fixtures essential for the aerospace/electronics sector.

  • Reinforced with CNT for ESD-safety, surface resistivity of 10⁴–10⁷ Ω/sq
  • High heat resistance up to 157°C HDT (0.45 MPa) after annealing.
  • Reinforced with 10% chopped fibers for high stiffness and dimensional accuracy.
  • PA612 Nylon base delivers reduced moisture sensitivity to maintain outstanding mechanical performance wet or dry.
  • Excellent dimensional stability during printing.

Why choose PA612-ESD

  • With a surface resistivity of 10⁴–10⁷ Ω/sq, Fiberon PA612-ESD protects sensitive components from static discharge—ideal for PCBs, enclosures, and cleanroom tools.

  • Reinforced with CNT and 10% carbon fiber, this filament delivers high stiffness, 84 MPa XY tensile strength, and consistent dimensional accuracy.

  • Maintain mechanical integrity in high-temperature environments with a heat deflection temperature of up to 157 °C at 0.45 MPa.

  • Prints fast—up to 300 mm/s—with low warping and excellent surface finish. Supports self-supporting structures and stays stable across long jobs.

  • Each spool is vacuum-sealed, tangle-free, and AMS - compatible—so your prints stay smooth and your workflow uninterrupted.

Print Settings:

Printing Temperature: 280˚C - 300˚C
Bed Temperature: 40˚C - 50˚C
Printing Speed: up to 300mm/s
Fan: OFF

Direct Drive:
Retraction Distance: 1-3mm
Retraction Speed: 20-40mm/s

Drying Settings: 100˚C for 10h
(Only if the material has absorbed moisture)

For even better performance, you can anneal this material for 16 hours @ 100°C.

Printing Requirements

  • All-metal hotend 280˚C+
  • Hardened nozzle
  • Annealing post printing
  • You may need a filament dryer depending on the humidity of your environment. Keep dry when not in use.

products.title: Polymaker Fiberon™ ASA-CF08 Filament 500g 1.75 mm
products.body_html:
Fiberon™ ASA-CF08 combines the UV and weather resistance of ASA with 8% carbon fiber by weight, delivering high rigidity, reduced warping, and a professional matte finish.
  • High performance ASA-CF with 8% carbon fiber reinforcement.
  • Outstanding UV, weather resistance and rigidity (3.6 GPa Tensile Modulus)
  • High heat resistance up to 100°C HDT.
  • Improved dimensional stability during printing.
  • Professional surface finish that helps to hide the layer lines.
  • Consistent colour and tolerance (1.75mm diameter +/- 0.02mm)

Fiberon™ is polymakers family of fiber-reinforced composite filaments developed to provide outstanding mechanical performance for a range of engineering applications.

Features

  • With a bending strength of 69.1 MPa (XY) and tensile strength of 43.5 MPa (XY), ASA-CF08 offers the reliability needed for load-bearing and precision parts.
  • ASA-CF08 has an HDT of up to 103 °C @0.45 MPa, making it perfect for enclosures, fixtures, and components exposed to direct sunlight or extreme heat without deformation.
  • With 6 color options available and a high quality matte finish that hides layer lines, ASA-CF08 is ideal for applications where aesthetics matter as much as function.
  • ASA-CF08 supports high-speed printing up to 350 mm/s, is less prone to warping and requires minimal chamber heating, making it a versatile choice for both professionals and hobbyists.
  • Each spool is vacuum-sealed and tangle-free so your prints stay smooth and your workflow uninterrupted.

products.title: Corvus ATX PC Case - Designed by Donald Sayers & MandicReally
products.body_html:
What if Voron Built a PC Case? MandicReally put that question to the test and built one absolutely stunning looking case. 

For more information and the necessary print files check out  Printables.

Every purchase directly supports the MandicReally studio to support future projects. 

Note:  Kits Included Acrylic Panel Kit (Clear) (7pc total), variant with cut out or not depending on selection. 

From MandicReally:

Imagine if the Voron Design team shifted from 3D printers to crafting a PC case—though they haven’t, this project imagines that vision. The VoronPC case is a fully 3D-printed, extrusion-framed chassis reflecting the minimalist, modular, and open-source principles of Voron printers. Engineered to accommodate a custom streaming workstation, it supports a 199mm tall air cooler tower and approximately 400mm GPU, with a standard ATX power supply positioned at the base. Included are mounting options for 140mm and 60mm exhaust fans, three 120mm top fans, and blank acrylic panel DXFs for customisable fan or window additions.

Features:

  • Voron-Inspired Construction – 2020 aluminium blind joint extrusion skeleton, acrylic panels, and a lot of 3D-printed parts.
  • Standard PC Layout – Supports ATX motherboards, GPUs, PSUs, water-cooling gear, and accessories.
  • Water-Cooling Friendly – Mounts for radiator, distro plate, pump/reservoir, and hardline tubing.
  • 3D Printing First – All panels, brackets, and mounts printable on common beds (Prusa MK4, Bambu X1, etc.).
  • Customisable Aesthetic – Change colors, panels, or remix the CAD to your own sizing.
  • Mods - Compatible with various Voron Mods (LED mounts, etc)

What is Included:

This package contains all the hardware required to assemble the case, as well as some custom components designed by LDO, including buttons and a PCB—details to be shared shortly. Please note, it does not include any PC components or printed parts.

Hardware Kit: 

  • Extrusions, Hardware, and VPC Front Io Board, Keyboard Switch (for Button), Misc Parts.

  • Cut Out Kit:

Your order will be shipped in two separate boxes: one for the hardware kit and another for the panel. If you order smaller parts or other large flat items together, we may be able to reduce and adjust the final freight charges after checkout, prior to capturing your payment.

products.title: TBI TM9NLS/TM12NLS Linear Rail with Carriage
products.body_html:
TBI Motion has earned recognition across the industry for precision engineering, and their linear rail systems exemplify that commitment to reliability and performance.

Specification: 

Highest (Z1) preload and Normal (H) precision guarantees a tight / play-free carriage.

  • Material: Stainless Steel Linear Rail 440C
  • Precision: Normal (N)
  • Pre-Load: High (Z1)
  • Arched Guide Way (increase max potential load and life compare to flat guide ways)
  • 1 Year Manufacturer Warranty
  • Block Size: TM9NLS or TM12NLS (Cross Compatibility with MGN9H/MGN12H - Note Datasheet block is slightly wider)

Note 1: As this is customised, the blocks are manually pre-loaded to Z1, laser engraving will be Z0. 

Note 2: Only transport grease are used, please clean, re-grease. When you remove block/carriage, please ensure you mark (back of carriage) to tell apart which rails/block pairing to avoid issue when re-installing. 

Rails and blocks are paired and are NOT interchangeable – if you need to remove take care removing a carriage block and use holder to remove/install block to prevent loosing ball bearings. 

Do you need custom length or customisation? Contact Us

Printer Compatibility:  

Suitable for Voron 2.4/Trident Y/Z Axis, always best to measure or check printer BOM size to ensure compatible. Suitable for other DIY/Custom printers, size depend on your printer. 

  • If you have a 250mm Voron you need the 300mm rail
  • If you have a 300mm Voron you need the 350mm rail
  • If you have a 350mm Voron you need the 400mm rail

These rails are also used in the standard BOM for the Voron Trident and Voron 2.4 Kit.

Documentation

products.title: E3D High Flow ObXidian™ HotEnd for Bambu Lab A1 & A1 Mini
products.body_html:
These high-quality HotEnds result from an official partnership between E3D and Bambu Lab. Featuring E3DLC™ coated nozzles, they offer outstanding wear resistance and surpass other hardened nozzles in performance, enabling your A1 to handle challenging filaments effortlessly. E3D is proud to be the sole officially approved producer of aftermarket HotEnds for Bambu Lab.

  • The High Flow design features an internal nozzle modification that boosts your volumetric flow rate by up to 70%. This upgrade delivers more reliable and consistent extrusion at existing speeds or allows you to increase the flow rate limit in your slicer, fully leveraging your motion system's potential.
  • Optimised for both speed and quality, these HotEnds preserve strong interlayer adhesion during high-speed printing, ensuring exceptional filament finish and durable parts suitable for functional use.
  • Equipped with the advanced E3DLC™ coating, the nozzle resists filament adhesion, significantly minimising print failures and eliminating surface imperfections in your prints.
  • Seamless Upgrade – These magnetic HotEnds are incredibly easy to install. With the heater and temperature wires integrated into the toolhead, simply detach your current HotEnd, insert the new one, and you’re ready to print. No adjustments to the mount or part-cooling system are necessary.
  • Durable Nozzles – Featuring E3D ObXidian™ technology, these nozzles offer vastly increased hardness compared to standard steel options, vastly extending their lifespan. 

Compatibility Printers:

  • Bambu A1 
  • Bambu A1 Mini

Please note, these HotEnds are not compatible with the Bambu Lab H2 Series printers. 

Includes:

  • 1 x Bambu Lab High Flow ObXidian HotEnd 0.40 mm or 0.60mm

Documentation:

Install Guide: https://e3d-online.com/pages/bambu-lab-a1-support-obxidian-nozzle

Print Profile: https://makerworld.com/en/models/1842294-e3d-a1-a1-mini-high-flow-obxidian-profiles

Avoid using 0.4mm with Galaxy/Glitter/Filled Filament, we found cht channel tend to partial clog over time on materials. 

ObXidian™ nozzles resist wear better than most others, but some advanced filaments with strong fillers—like those in Polymaker’s Fiberon range—can still wear them out. E3D is working on specialized solutions for these materials. Note that some fillers have particles as large as 0.4mm, which may cause jams with small nozzles. Always check your filament’s recommended nozzle size to ensure compatibility.

FAQs

Will these HotEnds actually reduce my print time?

Several factors influence print time reduction, including the specific part being printed. Typically, using E3D’s premade slicer profiles will result in shorter print times. However, for very small, intricate models with minimal or no infill, significant time savings may not be noticeable, as maintaining superior visual quality on the outer perimeters remains a priority.

Should I choose the ObXidian version or the DiamondBack version?

The choice depends on durability and your specific application. The ObXidian High Flow HotEnd performs exceptionally well for light to moderate use with filaments containing abrasive fillers like carbon fibre and glass fibre. Meanwhile, the DiamondBack version offers virtually no wear throughout the printer's lifespan, making it ideal for continuous, heavy-duty printing with aggressive-filled filaments—providing reliable, worry-free operation.

Will this nozzle ever wear?

Yes, given enough time these HotEnds may exhibit wear, but will do so considerably slower than a Hardened Steel nozzle. Wear resistance is difficult to quantify due to the numerous variables involved, including base polymer, additive, brand, temperature, and print speed.

Does this void my warranty with Bambu?

No, Bambu Lab have collaborated with E3D throughout the development of this product and has officially approved the use of these HotEnds.

Can I still print with normal filament like PLA?

Absolutely! Even using the standard Bambu Lab print profiles, you will notice more visual consistency due to improved thermal performance and flow boosting, enabling you to have stronger, better-looking parts.

Are these HotEnds compatible with the BambuLab H2 Series printers?

No, they are only compatible with the A1 and A1 Mini.

products.title: Microswiss CHT High Flow Hotend for Bambu Lab A1, A1 Mini, H2D, H2S
products.body_html:
The Microswiss CHT High Flow Hotend incorporates cutting-edge technology to enhance printing efficiency. It provides up to a 50% boost in maximum volumetric flow rate, enabling significantly faster print speeds while maintaining exceptional quality. Designed for easy plug-and-play installation, it integrates effortlessly with Bambu Lab A1, A1 Mini, H2D, and H2S models.

 With genuine Bondtech CHT

An official collaboration between Microswiss and Bondtech brings the CHT High Flow hotend for Bambu A1 and H2 Series printers. This nozzle incorporates patented CHT technology, specifically engineered to boost the flow rate and improve layer adhesion.

  • High Flow CHT
    Achieve a 50% maximum volumetric flow rate increase
  • Better layer adhesion
    More uniform layer deposition is achieved by splitting the filament flow into multiple chambers as it passes through the melt zone. This reduces gaps and weak points between layers

Tungsten Disulfide Coating

The nozzle tip is made from M2 hardened high-speed steel, heat-treated to an ultra-tough 68 HRC, and finished with a premium non-stick coating that resists plastic build-up for smoother, more reliable printing.

  • Heat-treated hardness: 68 HRC
  • Plated with a Electroless Nickel Plating
  • Coated with nonstick nano WS2 coating
  • Coefficient of friction: 0.035

Compatible Printers:

products.title: Polymaker™ High Temp HT-PLA-GF 1kg 1.75mm Filament
products.body_html:
Not everyone has the capability to print in high temperature filaments such as PETG, ASA or Nylon and some hobbyists and educators choose to only print in PLA. As we all know - PLA has always deformed in the heat, limiting the applications for these users.

Polymaker™ HT-PLA-GF offers improved heat resistance after annealing while maintaining PLA's ease of printing. It’s ideal for applications requiring high thermal stability, withstanding mechanical stress and temperatures up to 100°C. The high softening temperature is achieved before annealing, but the heat deflection temperature is achieved through a very short annealing process (30 minutes at 100°C).

Features

  • High Heat Stability - Polymaker™ HT-PLA-GF delivers high heat stability up to 130°C right off the printer, no post-processing required. Heat stability refers to the ability to remain dimensionally stable at elevated temperatures under no or minimal external load other than its own weight.
  • Good Heat Resistance - For applications that could face some mechanical force at elivated temperature, heat deflection temperature (HDT) is important. Polymaker™ HT-PLA-GF has been optimized for annealing so you can increase the HDT of your models, it's as easy as putting them in an oven at 100°C for 30 minutes. The glass-fiber reinforcement in Polymaker™ HT-PLA-GF significantly minimizes shrinkage during annealing, an issue that un-reinforced HT-PLA materials can face. With a high heat deflection temperature, Polymaker™ HT-PLA-GF is the perfect choice for power tool accessories, custom PC parts, heat shields and fan ducts.
  • Glass Fiber Reinforced - Polymaker™ HT-PLA-GF is glass fiber reinforced which significantly boosts tensile strength and stiffness for a wide range of functional applications that also require heat stability or heat resistance. The glass fibers also reduce "mechanical creep", a property that is also further reduced by annealing. It is worth noting that HT-PLA-GF exhibits lower z-axis layer adhesion compared to normal PLA which is common for glass-fiber reinforced materials.
  • High Speed Capable - Polymaker™ HT-PLA-GF is based on a high-speed PLA formula, enabling high speed printing up to 350mm/s and compatibility with a wide range of 1.75mm diameter machines. An enclosure is not needed for this high temp filament! You simply need a wear resistant nozzle due to the addition of glass-fibers.
  • No Compromise - At its core Polymaker™ HT-PLA-GF is a PLA-based multiphase composite, built around NatureWorks PLA so you can expect similar chemical resistance and the same low shrinkage rate as normal PLA. Combining Polymakers innovative R&D technologies, compounding and extrusion systems with Natureworks Ingeo® resins produces a reliable 3D printing filament to print beautiful and accurate models.

products.title: Polymaker™ High Temp HT-PLA 1kg 1.75mm Filament
products.body_html:
PLA remains the most popular choice for 3D printing, yet objects made from typical PLA filaments often warp when exposed to heat, like on warm summer days. Alternatives like PETG, ASA, or Nylon provide superior heat resistance; however, many users—ranging from hobbyists to educational institutions and small businesses—prefer PLA because of its broad compatibility with various printers.

Polymaker™ HT-PLA redefines heat-resistant 3D printing by providing a user-friendly PLA filament that retains its form in unstressed conditions at elevated temperatures up to 130°C without warping or distortion. It combines the straightforward printing experience and environmental benefits of PLA with enhanced thermal stability, eliminating the need for post-processing.

Need a PLA that has heat resistance with some load? Checkout Polymaker™ HT-PLA-GF which features glass fibers and is optimized for annealing.

  • Prints Like a Dream
    HT-PLA runs flawlessly on most FDM printers using standard PLA settings—no upgrades or tuning needed. And with print speeds up to 300mm/s, you’ll get pro-quality results faster than ever.
  • Eco-Friendly Meets Engineering-Grade
    Get the reliability and sustainability of PLA with the heat stability of advanced materials. No post-processing required—just print and go.
  • Vibrant Colors
    From prototypes to final products, match your vision with 14 rich, eye-catching colors that make every print stand out.
  • Need Even More Strength?
    For next-level mechanical performance, check out Polymaker HT-PLA-GF —a glass fiber-reinforced version built for serious strength.

Gradient Cycle Time:
Rainbow - 200g
Fire - 120g
Ice - 100g
Tropical - 120g

None! This will print great on any stock 3D printer!

You will just want to print slower on stock, older style printers.

products.title: Graphite Heated Bed For Voron 2.4 / Trident 300/350
products.body_html:
Pre-assembled Graphite heatbed for Voron 2.4 / Trident 300/350 3D printers

  • No warping: bed stays super flat at 120C as well as at 60C. No need to heat soak the bed for long time like aluminum beds.
  • Heats ~40% faster than the stock bed.
  • Maximum bed temperature up to 130C compared to 105C stock bed.
  • 1000W Heater has an inbuilt 150C self-recovery thermal switch for safety.
  • Works with Eddy current sensors (Cartographer, Beacon, BTT Eddy)

What is Included:

  • Pre-assembled Graphite Bed (with 1000W heater, magnet, grounding wire) for Voron 300 or 350, (depending on your selection) 

Documentation: 

General Note: You should never cut into AC heater pad. 

Preparation:

Before applying either the magnetic sheet(for steel flex plate) or silicone heater to the bottom side we recommend to scuff surface with steel wool and wipe clean with isopropyl alcohol (IPA) before application. For Graphite, ensure the surface is completely dried before applying anything onto build plate such as AC Pad or Magnet. 

More Info: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vZx4vfevwx4

More Info AC Pad Install/FAQ: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000302252-keenovo-ac-heater-faq

Shipping Note: 

We ship items in a flat cardboard sandwich box to prevent warping during transit. This item cannot be combined with non-flat items for shipping, so please expect additional freight costs when bundling it with smaller parts or filament. If we can bundle smaller items within the same box, we will update the shipping total before processing your payment. Otherwise, feel free to contact support for a customised quote.

Note

  • To make sure the optimum performance for this heater is achievable, both temperature sensing and control elements should installed to controller.

Caution

  • The Heater Mat is not suitable for stand-alone operation.
  • Do not cut into the heater pad
  • Ensure proper strain relief on wiring and proper grounding of the cast bed.

Warning

  • These heaters shall only be used where adequate electrical, thermal and mechanical barriers are provided to prevent access to hazardous parts without the use of a tool.

products.title: NiteHawk Hexa 6+1 USB Expander PCB
products.body_html:
Nitehawk Hexa is a 6+1 port USB hub adapter purpose-built for USB-based tool boards. It integrates the capabilities of six Nitehawk USB adapters, a USB 2.0 hub, and a 24V power splitter into a single, compact PCB. Nitehawk Hexa is the ideal solution for multi-toolhead 3D printers such as IDEX or tool changer systems, offering a clean and reliable way to manage power and communication across multiple tool boards.


Features

  • Convenient wiring, use a single 24V power cable (included) and standard USB C cable upstream to handle power + traffic of up to 6 downstream toolboards.
  • Plug and play, functions just like a normal USB hub — no additional software, drivers, or configuration required.
  • Extra USB-A port, an extra USB A port downstream allows you to plug in any standard USB device (webcam, flash drive, Arduino etc.)
  • 30A current rating, engineered for demanding setups with up to six heated toolheads. Features a high-current screw terminal rated for 30A and dedicated power/ground planes on the PCB to support heavy loads safely.
  • Dedicated power protection, each downstream port includes its own data line protection and a replaceable fuse. The upstream USB-C input is protected by standard USB ESD protection circuitry.

Documentation:

  • Nitehawk Hexa | LDO Documentation

products.title: DiamondBack Prusa Nextruder Nozzles for MK4/XL/Core One
products.body_html:
These premium DiamondBack Prusa nozzles bring you the most extreme Nextruder Nozzle solution to date.

Pre-Order - Lead time 1.5-2.5 weeks (We contact you if you lead time will be longer than quoted before)

Key features:

  • Easy installation
  • Print any filament!
  • Solid Diamond, not just a coating
  • Heat creep resistant HeatBreak

Compatibility:

  • Prusa MK3.9/S
  • Prusa MK4
  • Prusa MK4S
  • Prusa XL
  • Prusa Core One

Why Choose Diamond?

The rapid development of fibre, metal and ceramic filaments has increased the need for abrasion-resistant nozzles. Compared with all the nozzle options on the market, DiamondBack’s diamonds deliver unmatched wear-resistance and versatility.

Smooth and Hard. Unlock extreme wear resistance thanks to DiamondBack’s Polycrystalline Diamond (PCD) tips. These diamonds are composed of thousands of tiny diamond crystals with a proprietary binder that forms a matrix of crystals joined with diamond-to-diamond bonds. They retain the hardness properties of diamond whilst reducing the inherent brittleness of a single-crystal diamond, making them a fantastic choice for printing with engineering grade metal and ceramic-filled filaments.

Precision Printing. DiamondBack nozzles rely on a solid diamond tip to improve precision 3D printing. The tip is not a diamond coating, but rather a solid diamond insert made from the hardest material in the world.

Longevity. The PCD used in these Prusa Nextruder Nozzles significantly extends nozzle life. It provides best-in-class thermal conductivity which improves interlayer adhesion for stronger prints, and the low coefficient of friction combined with a polished tip creates super smooth top layers with an ironing-like effect.

Effortless Upgrade. These Nozzles are a drop-in replacement for your stock Prusa Nextruder Nozzle, no adjustment to the mount or part cooling is required. Watch Prusa's official guide here.

Some filled materials contain particles that are close to, if not larger than, some of the smaller industry standard nozzle sizes, including up to 0.4mm. Attempting to print such materials through these nozzle sizes significantly increases the risk a jam. Please check your filament manufacturer’s datasheet for recommended minimum nozzle orifice diameter to ensure that the nozzle/hotend you choose is suitable for your use case.

products.title: Bigtreetech Panda Branch V1.0 Power Expansion Board
products.body_html:
The Bigtreetech / BIQU Panda Branch V1.0 is a power expansion board designed for X1/P1/A1 series printers. It features four 5V outputs, which can be used to power devices such as the Panda Touch, USB fans, and USB light strips. Additionally, it includes the MX3.0 2x2 Pin interface for powering the AMS/AMS Lite.

Features Highlights

  • Includes four USB-A 5V outputs for powering LED strips, Panda Touch, and other accessories.
  • Features a reserved DIP switch for precise current output selection at 5V, providing enhanced protection.
  • Offers integrated reverse connection protection and overcurrent fuses for all output interfaces.
  • The 5V output includes a fault indicator light that glows red when overcurrent protection is triggered, simplifying troubleshooting during DIY projects.
  • Designed with a compact 20mm-wide frame, aligning all interfaces in the same direction for cleaner and more practical cable management.

Specifications

  • Dimensions: 145mm x 20mm
  • Power Input: DC 24V
  • Output Voltage: 5V, 2.7A (Peak)
  • 5V Output Ports: 4
  • MX3.0 2x2 Pin Interfaces

Documentation: 

  • Wiki: https://bttwiki.com/PandaBranch.html

products.title: LDO Orbitool O2S Toolboard Kit
products.body_html:
LDO Orbitool OS2 Toolboard Kit is a toolhead PCB with a STM32F042 MCU, TMC2240, Accelerometer all integrated into one board and also USB Hub. The form factor is design for Orbiter 2 or 2.5 Extruder.

Features: 

  • Optimized for Orbiter v2, v2.5 shape and features including orbiter sensor
  • STM32F072 microcontroller running on 48MHz - ful klipper support with automatic update possibility
  • Automotive USB communication with Raspberry PI
  • One auxiliary USB connector for bed scanner, nozzle camera or other intelligent USB connected accessory
  • Onboard ADXL345 accelerometer
  • TMC2240 extruder stepper driver - for a better thermal behavior
  • Direct connection to Orbiter v2 sensor
  • PWM 4,3,2 wire part fan output, compatible with 12/24V fan types with RPM speed input signal
  • DC-DC converter based Hot-end fan driver, compatible with 12/24V fan types with RPM speed input signal
  • Hot-end temperature sensor input compatible with standard NTC or PT1000 temperature sensor types
  • I2C for bed level sensing and scanning
  • X-Stop sensor input
  • RGB LED driver output
  • Onboard temperature sensor
  • Advanced thermal management system

Built in safety features (Smokeless Features):

  1. Active short circuit protected Hot - end output
  2. Active short circuit protected fan driver outputs
  3. Active Protection circuit against reverse power supply connection
  4. Protection against loss of GND supply
  5. Analog and digital inputs protected against short to +24V supply voltage
  6. USB data lines protected against short circuits to GND and +24V 
  7. RGB LED power supply pin protected against short to GND 
  8. EMI interference and ESD protection an all inputs and outputs 
  9. Heater thermal runaway protection in case of short between heater and sense thermistor wires

Documentation: 

Github: https://github.com/RobertLorincz/Orbiter-Toolboards

LDO Doc O2S: https://github.com/RobertLorincz/Orbiter-Toolboards/tree/main/Orbiter%20O2S%20Toolboard/Documentations

Project Information: https://www.orbiterprojects.com/so3/
