products.title: Magigoo Supergrip 3D Bed Adhesion Solution for Flex Plates - 50ml
products.body_html:
Optimized Adhesion for Flexible Build Plates and a Wide Range of Materials

Magigoo Supergrip is a premium adhesive engineered for flexible build plates and polymer surfaces. It works seamlessly with materials such as PLA, PETG, ABS/ASA, and TPU, providing consistent first-layer adhesion and smooth print removal. Its water-based composition ensures effortless cleaning, while one bottle supports over 250 full-bed uses (on a 235x235mm bed). This solution enhances print reliability and preserves your build plate from damage. Suitable for a wide temperature range, Magigoo Supergrip guarantees robust and dependable adhesion with every print.

Note:  Does not work on Glass or G11

Key Features of the Magigoo Supergrip:

  • Designed for optimal performance on flexible and polymer-based build plates, including PEI, PC, and satin sheets
  • Supports a wide range of materials including PLA, PET-G, ABS/ASA, and TPU
  • Extended usage life with over 250 full-bed applications per 235×235mm surface
  • Superior adhesion strength across a wider temperature range, including enhanced performance with PLA and ASA
  • Easy water-based cleaning and effortless part removal after cooling

Compatible with:

  • Textured PEI
  • Smooth PEI
  • Engineering Plates / Satin PEI
  • Kapton Tape
  • BuildTak
  • PC Plates
  • PEY+PEO
  • Bare Metal
  • PEX

Safety Data Sheet

  • SDS

Instructions for Use

Follow these simple steps to get the best results with Magigoo Supergrip:

  1. Shake the Bottle – Shake well for 3–5 seconds before each use to ensure proper mixing.

  2. Apply to Build Plate – Unscrew the cap and press the applicator tip against the build surface. Magigoo should flow freely; gently squeeze the bottle if needed while keeping the tip in contact with the plate.

  3. Spread Evenly – Apply a thin, even layer of adhesive over the desired print area.

  4. Start Printing – Begin your print immediately. The adhesive will dry as the bed heats—no need to wait for it to dry beforehand.

  5. Remove the Print – After printing, flex the build plate to release the print. If it resists, let it cool for a few minutes before trying again.

  6. Clean and Reapply – For optimal performance, wipe the build plate with a damp cloth to remove residue, allow it to dry, and reapply Magigoo before your next print.

Additional Information: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000287772-magigoo-instruction-manual

products.body_html:
After market V6 Bi Metal Hotend (TZ Nozzle) V2.0 using TZ nozzle with ceramic heater, up to 33mm/s max potential flow rate.

  • The heat sink and heat break can be disassembled and locked by the side fixed shaft to reduce maintenance costs. 
  • The TC4 chromium zirconium copper and titanium heat break tube and the heat block increases the step surface at the bottom of the throat to completely eliminate the phenomenon of the nozzle falling off and reduces the possibility of leakage.
  • Cost effective V6 replacement for DIY 3D Printers.

What is Included:

  • 1x V6 Style TZ2.0 Hotend Kit 

Printer Compatibility:

Nozzle support: TZ Nozzle or V6 Nozzle (V6 nozzle will 1.9mm sit lower than TZ nozzle, in most case in our experience is not major compatible issues with most tool heads but please double check with desire tool head) 

Specification: 

  • Thermistor Type: 104NT-4
  • Heater: 24v 48w

Other Spares: 

  • Silicon Sock
  • TZ M6 Nozzle (Harden Steel)
  • TZ M6 Nozzle (Bi Metal Harden Steel + Copper)

Documentation: 

  • We highly recommended hot you hot tighten nozzle and PID autotune before use. We recommend setting to max printing temperature that printer supports. Documentation: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000318231-how-to-hot-tighten-nozzle-change-a-nozzle (If you have issues with your first layer, adjust gcode first layer offset value and its recommended you re-tune your materials flow ratio) 
  • Our recommendation is apply some included thermal paste or high temperature thermal grease/paste on heater/thermistor for more accurate temperature reporting. 
  • Pre-installed nozzle has thread lock pre-applied at the factory, you are require to heat up above 250c to loosen thread lock to swap/change nozzle. Ensure you wrench to hold the heater block in place so its does not twist. Note: Recommenced is max 1.5nm when tightening/loosening to prevent snapping nozzle, although over time due to heat cycling materials (harden steel) can become more brittle over time (aging) starting with lower torque where possible is recommended.

products.title: Micro Swiss FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality K2 Plus / K2
products.body_html:
The Micro Swiss FlowTech Hotend incorporates cutting-edge technology for enhanced printing performance. Combined with Bondtech CHT High Flow Nozzles, it can achieves flow rates up to 50 mm³/sec, enabling rapid printing speeds while maintaining high-quality results. Its straightforward, plug-and-play installation ensures effortless compatibility with your Creality K2 Plus printer.

Made in USA by Microswiss

FlowTech™ Hotend for Creality K2 Plus Features

  • Leak-Proof Nozzle:
    Tired of messy nozzle leaks that ruin your prints and waste filament? FlowTech Hotend combines nozzle and thermal break into one permanently sealed assembly that ensures a leak-proof hotend.

  • Cold Nozzle Change:
    Swapping out nozzles used to be a time-consuming and potentially hazardous task. With a FlowTech Hotend, nozzle changes are effortless, and there's no need for hot tightening, and you can do it with just one hand.

  • CHT High Flow Nozzle Performance:

    An official collaboration between Microswiss and Bondtech brings the CHT High Flow nozzle to the FlowTech ecosystem. This nozzle incorporates proprietary CHT technology, specifically engineered to boost the flow rate and improve layer adhesion.

    • High Flow CHT
      The FlowTech nozzle, equipped with Bondtech CHT technology, can achieve a maximum volumetric flow rate of up to 50 mm³/sec 
    • Better layer adhesion
      More uniform layer deposition is achieved by splitting the filament flow into multiple chambers as it passes through the melt zone. This reduces gaps and weak points between layers

  • All-Metal Design:
    Built to last! FlowTech hotend features an all-metal design that can handle most modern 3D printing filaments. The entire hotend is machined and assembled in-house, with quality control performed at multiple stages during the manufacturing process. At the end, each hotend undergoes a full thermal cycling test before it is packaged.

  • 350°C Max Temperature:
    This hotend is rated at 350°C temperature with a properly tuned NTC thermistor for each specific printer. This particular edition is perfectly tuned for  Creality K2 Plus so no firmware changes are needed.

Fits:

  • Creality K2 Plus
  • Creality K2

What is include:

  • 1x FlowTech™ Heater Core
  • 1x FlowTech™ CM2 CHT 0.4mm Nozzle
  • 1x Heatsink
  • 2x Titanium Mounting Screws
  • 1x Silicon Sock

 Documentation

      Coming soon...

products.title: Jabberwocky Complete Toolhead /w Filament Cutter & Extruder for 3D printers & Multi-Filament setups
products.body_html:
Behold, brave knights of the 3D printing realm, and tremble (with delight!) before the Jabberwocky! This isn't just a toolhead; it's a mythical beast, tamed and miniaturized to grant your multi-material 3D printer the power of a thousand tiny dragons.

GitHub (Printed Files/Documentation): https://github.com/kinematicdigit/Jabberwocky

Spare Part Listing: https://store.dremc.com.au/products/ldo-jabberwocky-spare-parts

What is difference between options: 

  • Assembled - This is fully assembled at the LDO facility and ready to install in your printer (after you print the correct mounting plate for your printer). It is intended to save time or for less effort.

  • Hardware Kit - Also sometimes referred to as DIY or Unassembled. This is the recommended kit for beginners to advanced users. Visit this above Wiki link for instructions.

A Ferocious Feast for Filaments!

Tired of your printer sputtering like a grumpy goblin when you try to switch colours? Does your current setup have the filament-swapping grace of a clumsy ogre? Fear not! The Jabberwocky arrives, ready to devour your material woes and spit out perfectly printed masterpieces. With its integrated filament cutter, this isn't just about switching filaments; it's about vanquishing them. Old filament? Snip! New filament? Chomp! The Jabberwocky makes transitions smoother than a buttered bingle-berry slide.

What Makes this Beast So Grand?

  • The Phaetus Conch Hot End: Because your prints deserve a hot end as beautiful and intricate as a nautilus shell, but with the searing power of a thousand suns (okay, maybe just one really efficient sun). This hot end delivers flow of 35mm^3.s
  • Integrated Extruder with Orbiter Gears & LDO NEMA14 Motor: This dynamic duo pulls filament with the unwavering determination of a questing hero. No slipping, no grinding, just pure, unadulterated extrusion power.
  • Dual 3010 High Static Pressure Fans: These aren't just fans; they're miniature wind gods, precisely cooling your prints with the force of a hurricane in a teacup. Say goodbye to droopy overhangs and hello to crisp, clean lines!
  • Dual Sensor Filament Array: The Jabberwocky has two eyes (sensors, really) to keep a watchful gaze on your filament supply. Runout? Not on its watch! It'll screech (gently, via LED) before you ever waste a moment.
  • Bondtech Drive Gears: The legendary grip of a thousand tiny kraken, ensuring your filament is never lost at sea.
  • Nitehawk 36 Toolhead Board: The brains of the operation, sleek and sophisticated, orchestrating every move with effortless grace. USB connection ensures simple configuration on almost any Klipper machine.
  • Nozzle LEDs & Status LED: Because even mythical beasts need to look good and keep you informed. Watch your print progress illuminate like a tiny, glowing prophecy!
  • Filament Cutter Cable Strain Relief: No more tangled tentacles! We've made sure this beast's cables are as well-behaved as a perfectly trained pixie.

So, if you're ready to banish the woes of filament fumbles and unleash the true potential of your multi-material machine, arm yourself with the Jabberwocky. Your printer (and your sanity) will thank you. Just try not to get too close; it might try to explain thermodynamics in rhyming couplets.

Features:

  • Power supply for stepper motors with two voltage options: 24V and 48V.
  • Equipped with a buzzer with a centre operating frequency of 27 kHz, which can be customised to produce different sounds by changing the frequency.
  • Adds two 3-pin fan interfaces and two temperature detection interfaces.
  • Equipped with reverse polarity protection.

products.title: Box Turtle AFC-IO Board / Input-Output Box Turtle
products.body_html:
Excerpt from GitHub:

The BoxTurtle IO (BTIO) module simplifies the integration of your BoxTurtle multi-color system with your 3D printer by serving as a centralized hub for all essential connections. It offers a clean, dependable interface for linking the printer, connecting the toolhead buffer, and supporting daisy-chained configurations for multi-unit expansion. BTIO also enables external power delivery when operating over USB. This modular design supports scalable, intelligent filament handling while keeping wiring complexity to a minimum.

With the exception of USB lines, all ground connections on this board share a common ground. While only one ground is electrically necessary for the toolhead buffer, the “TN” port includes two ground pins to mirror the original connector layout. This design allows users to repin their toolhead buffer cable into a new single connector—without the need for soldering—when adapting it for use with the BTIO board.

This item cannot be combined with non-flat items for shipping, so please expect additional freight costs when bundling it with smaller parts or filament. If we can bundle smaller items within the same box, we will update the shipping total before processing your payment. Otherwise, feel free to contact support for a customised quote.

Preparation:

Before applying either the magnetic sheet(for steel flex plate) or silicone heater to the bottom side we recommend to scuff surface with steel wool and wipe clean with isopropyl alcohol (IPA) before application. For Graphite, ensure the surface is completely dried before applying anything onto build plate such as AC Pad or Magnet.

Caution

  • The Heater Mat is not suitable for stand-alone operation.
  • Do not cut into the heater pad
  • Ensure proper strain relief on wiring and proper grounding of the cast bed.

Warning

  • These heaters shall only be used where adequate electrical, thermal and mechanical barriers are provided to prevent access to hazardous parts without the use of a tool.

products.title: High Flow ObXidian™ Complete HotEnd for Bambu Lab X1-C/P1 Series
products.body_html:
E3D are very proud to be the only officially approved manufacturer of aftermarket Bambu Lab HotEnds! These ObXidian High Flow HotEnds were developed in collaboration with Bambu Lab, bringing you one of the most compact, lightweight and, more importantly, performant HotEnds to date.

High Flow. There's no denying that the Bambu Lab X1 and P1 series printers are built for speed. However, the motion system, as remarkable as it is, has headroom to be even better. That's where E3D High Flow technology comes in. Using our internal nozzle modification, we've managed to increase the volumetric flow rate of the HotEnd by 60%! That means you can expect more reliable and consistent extrusion at the same speeds or bump up the volumetric flow rate limit in the slicer to utilise the motion systems' capabilities fully.

Smooth and Hard. We've applied our E3DLC™ coating to the nozzle and heater parts, adding even more abrasive resistance for all your fibre-filled fun and a non-stick protective layer to prevent plastic build-up on the Nozzle.

Improved Layer Adhesion. High speed printing often sacrifices visual and functional aspects in favour of speed but these Hotends maintain interlayer adhesion strength even at higher speeds; resulting in the correct filament finish and strong parts for functional applications. Don't just take our word for it though - check out this video from Printing Perspective where he puts it to the test!

No Compromise. All of these new additions come in the same form factor as your stock Bambu. Simply drop-in place with no adjustment to the mount or part cooling required. Complete the upgrade in under 5 mins with our installation video guide.

Compatibility. These kits come in two different variants with matching connectors for the X1 series and P1 series printers

Avoid using 0.4mm with Galaxy/Glitter Filament, we found cht channel tend to partial clog over time on materials. 

Includes

  • 1 x Bambu Lab High Flow ObXidian HotEnd 0.40 mm or 0.60mm
  • 1 x Thermal Grease
  • 1 x Bambu Lab Sock
  • 1 x Bambu Lab Heater Retaining Spring
  • 2 x Bambu Lab Bolts

Documentation:

https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000427574-install-an-e3d-high-flow-obxidian-hotend-on-your-bambu-lab

Please note:

  • The X1 and P1 E3D Bambu Lab ObXidian High Flow Hotends are not compatible with the X1E printer. X1E Hotend Here: https://store.dremc.com.au/products/e3d-high-flow-hta-complete-hotend-for-bambu-lab-x1e
  • ObXidian™ coated nozzles are exceptionally wear resistant compared to other products on the market and significantly outperform other hardened nozzles. Improvements in ‘exotic’ engineering filaments mean that some new materials which include aggressive fillers, including but not limited to Polymaker’s PolyMide range (PA612-CF, PA6-CF, PA6-GF and PA12-CF), can cause significant wear on even ObXidian nozzles. E3D is actively developing even more specialist solutions for these materials. In the meantime please be aware that even the rainbows and unicorns in your ObXidian nozzle are not everlasting under extreme material conditions.
  • Some filled materials contain particles that are close to, if not larger than, some of the smaller industry standard nozzle sizes, including up to 0.4mm. Attempting to print such materials through these nozzle sizes significantly increases the risk a jam. Please check your filament manufacturer’s datasheet for recommended minimum nozzle orifice diameter to ensure that the nozzle/hotend you choose is suitable for your use case.

products.title: Polymaker Fiberon™ PET-CF17 500g 1.75mm
products.body_html:
Fiberon PET-CF17 carbon fiber reinforced filament excels at rapid prototyping, offering exceptional print quality and dimensional accuracy. Combining the best of strength, speed, and surface finish into one versatile composite filament.

  • High performance PET-CF with 17% carbon fiber reinforcement.
  • High bending modulus and tensile strength.
  • High heat resistance up to 147℃ HDT after annealing.
  • Low moisture sensitivity for humidity or wet applications.
  • Cost-effective and high speed capable.
  • Fantastic dimensional stability.
  • Reliable and consistent tolerance (1.75mm diameter +/- 0.03mm)

Fiberon™ is polymakers family of fiber-reinforced composite filaments developed to provide outstanding mechanical performance for a range of engineering applications.

Features

  • Excellent stiffness & moisture insensitivity - Compounded with 17% chopped carbon fiber, Fiberon PET-CF17 delivers excellent mechanical strength and stiffness for a wide range of jig, fixture, automotive and manufacturing applications. Fiberon PET-CF17 is a "moisture insensitive" composite filament[1] , ensuring excellent mechanical properties regardless of moisture absorption. This is in comparison to parts produced in nylon-based carbon fiber that absorb moisture from the air, a process which reduces tensile strength and stiffness of carbon fiber nylon parts. With Fiberon PET-CF17, users can print end-use parts for a wide range of industries without concerns of mechanical performance if the component is exposed to humid or wet applications.
  • High Heat Resistance - Featuring a heat deflection temperature of up to 147°C after annealing[2], Fiberon PET-CF17 heat resistance delivers an easy-to-use composite material for a wide range of end-use applications.
  • High Speed Capable - Fiberon PET-CF17 has been developed with printer compatibility in mind and is high speed capable, enabling printing up to 300mm/s on suitable high speed printers.
  • Dimensional Accuracy & Excellent Surface Finish - Carbon fiber reinforcement in Fiberon PET-CF17 delivers an outstanding surface finish with fantastic dimensional accuracy and low shrinkage during printing.

[1] Moisture insensitivity does not describe whether the filament should be kept dry for optimal print quality. This description of moisture insensitivity is in the context of the end-use application where extremely moisture sensitive materials like PA6-CF see a significant reduction in mechanical properties as the part absorbs moisture. With PET-CF moisture absorption is minimal and doesn't impact the mechanical properties of the part. For best printing results PET-CF17 should still be kept dry during printing and storage.
[2] Fiberon™ PET-CF17 displays the best mechanical and thermal properties when fully crystallized. The printed part will not reach full crystallization during the printing process, an additional step is required: Annealing. PET-CF17 can be annealed in the oven at 120˚C for 10 hours.

products.title: Polymaker Fiberon™ PA6-GF25 500g 1.75mm (Formerly PolyMide™ PA6-GF)
products.body_html:
Industrial glass-fiber reinforced Nylon 6 delivers high stiffness and impact strength for a wide range of high performance applications requiring stiffness and durability such as lab equipment, brackets, jigs and fixtures.

  • Glass-fiber reinforced Nylon 6 combines excellent mechanical performance with high stiffness & heat resistance.
  • Reinforced with 25% chopped fibers delivering excellent tensile layer-adhesion, stiffness and high strength to weight ratio.
  • Excellent strength, stiffness and impact strength in "dry state".
  • High heat resistance up to 191℃ HDT (0.45 MPa) after annealing.
  • Cost-effective price to performance ratio.
  • Excellent dimensional stability during printing.
  • Cardboard spool & packaging (made from 100% recycled cardboard)

PolyMide PA6-GF has transitioned to Polymakers Fiberon range and is now sold as Fiberon PA6-GF25 (same product, new name and packaging)

Fiberon™ is polymakers family of fiber-reinforced composite filaments developed to provide outstanding mechanical performance for a range of engineering applications.

Fiberon™ PA6-GF25 is an industrial glass fiber reinforced PA6 (Nylon 6) filament featuring 25% chopped glass fibers by weight. The material exhibits excellent thermal and mechanical properties without sacrificing the layer adhesion like with many other glass-fiber reinforced filaments. This is achieved through Polymakers Fiber-Adhesion™ technology which optimizes the surface chemistry of the fibers to achieve better dispersion and bonding to the Nylon 6 matrix and delivers an outstanding filament for functional applications. Fiberon™ PA6-GF25 offers an excellent cost-to-performance ratio for many end-use and functional applications.

Why choose PA6-GF25

  • Excellent Stiffness & Strength - Featuring a tensile modulus up to 5.3 GPA on the XY axis and 3.3 GPA on the Z axis, Fiberon™ PA6-GF25 combines excellent stiffness and toughness to deliver a versatile and high performance filament for a wide variety of high performance and dry industrial or engineering applications[1].
  • Excellent Heat Resistance - Featuring a heat deflection temperature of up to 191°C after annealing[2], Fiberon™ PA6-GF25 can be used to print parts working in a wide temperature range and has been utilized to create custom lab equipment working at temperatures as low as -190°C.
  • Outstanding Layer Adhesion - Most fiber reinforced materials show a decrease in z-axis layer adhesion when compared with their non-fiber reinforced Nylons, producing a part that is only stronger on the X-Y axis but detrimental to the Z axis. Fiber-Adhesion™ technology not only solves this problem but actually increases Z axis tensile strength creating more isotropic parts that are strong in every direction.
  • Warp-Free™ - Warp-Free™ technology enables the production of Nylon-based filaments that can be 3D printed with excellent dimensional stability and near-zero warpage. This is achieved by the fine control of microstructure and crystallization behaviour of Nylon, which enables the material to fully release the internal stress before solidification. The Warp-Free™ technology is designed to work best with minimal bed temperatures.
  • Wear Resistant and Tough - Parts printed in Fiberon™ PA6-GF25 display excellent strength and wear resistant properties.
  • Improved Printability – Unlike many other Nylon filaments, Fiberon™ PA6-GF25 is extremely easy to work with, exhibiting excellent dimensional stability. It is compatible with most filament-based 3D printers with no heated bed or chamber required!
  • Uncompromised Quality - Polymakers leading quality control process and rigorous in-house testing ensure reliable printing and consistency across spools and batches.
 

[1] Most Nylon parts in the real world undergo a process called "Moisture conditioning" which improves toughness and flexibility of the Nylon while reducing tensile strength and stiffness. Unless protected with a moisture barrier, PA6-GF shows a greater change in mechanical properties when subjected to water / high humidity in comparison to long-chain nylon filaments like PA12-CF or PA612-CF. In simple terms PA6-GF will typically offer the best properties in a dry application, but for a wet or high humidity application a longer chain nylon such as PA612 or PA12 may be better.
[2] Fiberon™ PA6-GF25 displays the best mechanical and thermal properties when fully crystallized. The printed part will not reach full crystallization during the printing process, an additional step is required: Annealing. Fiberon™ PA6-GF25 can be annealed in the oven at 100˚C for 16 hours right after the printing process.

Note 1: Change Nozzle

  • Pre-installed nozzle has thread lock pre-applied at the factory, you are require to heat up above 250c to loosen thread lock to swap/change nozzle. Ensure you wrench to hold the heater block in place so its does not twist. Note: Recommenced is max 1.5nm when tightening/loosening to prevent snapping nozzle, although over time due to heat cycling materials (harden steel) can become more brittle over time (aging) starting with lower torque where possible is recommended.

products.body_html:
Upgrade your Anycubic Kobra S1 with this Fysetc TZ Series ceramic hotend assembly. Purpose-built for the Kobra S1 platform, the ceramic heater provides enhanced heat retention and thermal consistency. This after market replacement component ensures perfect compatibility. 

What is Included: 

  • 1x Aftermarket Ceramic Hotend (0.4mm) for Kobra S1
  • 1x Nozzle Wrench Tool

Note: You require to use existing cold end/heat sink from your existing printer.

Features:

  • Compatible with Anycubic Kobra S1 3D Printer.
  • Note: This hotend use TZ Nozzle
  • Supports a range of filament types including PLA, PETG, TPU, ABS etc. 
  • Newer version (depending batch, shipped randomly) with protective wire sleeves on thermistor for improve reliability

Other Spares: 

  • Heater + Thermistor 
  • Silicon Sock
  • TZ M6 Nozzle (Harden Steel)
  • TZ M6 Nozzle (Bi Metal Harden Steel + Copper)

Specifications:

  • Nozzle Size: 0.4mm TZ Nozzle (Harden Steel Nozzle)
  • Maximum Operating Temperature: Up to 280°C (up to 350°c without sock)
  • Filament Diameter Compatibility: 1.75mm.
  • Components Included: Hotend assembly, heating cartridge, thermistor, mounting screws, and installation manual.

Documentation: 

  • How to Replace Hotend: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000487490-how-to-replace-kobra-s1-hotend

Note 1: Hot Tightening Nozzle 

  • We highly recommended hot you hot tighten nozzle and PID autotune before use. We recommend setting to max printing temperature that printer supports. Documentation: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000318231-how-to-hot-tighten-nozzle-change-a-nozzle (If you have issues with your first layer, adjust gcode first layer offset value and its recommended you re-tune your materials flow ratio) 

Note 2: Harden Nozzle

  • As its harden steel nozzle, you will need increase printing temperature compare to stock brass nozzle hotend, usually 10-20c more or you will need reduce printing speed or max flow rate. 

Note 3: Change Nozzle

  • Pre-installed nozzle has thread lock pre-applied at the factory, you are require to heat up above 250c to loosen thread lock to swap/change nozzle. Ensure you wrench to hold the heater block in place so its does not twist. Note: Recommenced is max 1.5nm when tightening/loosening to prevent snapping nozzle, although over time due to heat cycling materials (harden steel) can become more brittle over time (aging) starting with lower torque where possible is recommended.

products.title: CHC XP1 High Flow Hotend for Bambu X1 and P1 Series
products.body_html:
Engineered for the Bambu X1 and P1 series, the CHC XP1 hotend maximises material throughput whilst maintaining compatibility with your existing printer setup. This high-flow replacement delivers accelerated print speeds without requiring significant modifications, making it an ideal upgrade for users seeking faster production cycles and enhanced extrusion capacity.

Note: This is Wear Resistant Version (Ceramic Coating) (with Heater/Thermistor for X1 or P1) you will need re-use existing hotend cooling fan or source extra below:

X1: https://store.dremc.com.au/products/2510-axial-hotend-fan-24v-by-dremc-for-bambu-x1-series

P1: https://store.dremc.com.au/products/2510-axial-hotend-fan-5v-by-trianglelab-for-bambu-p1-series

Highlights:

  • It is compatible with standard V6 nozzles, which means more nozzle options.
  • Easily replace the nozzle without removing the entire hotend.
  • Rugged structural design, will not be easily damaged by collision.
  • Maximum flow rate for the same form factor.
  • Wear-resistant versions with ceramic bore coating are available.
  • The filament can be melted more thoroughly, which saves printing time while increasing layer adhesion and the strength of the printed part.
  • Longer hot melt sections have little or no negative impact on print results.
  • Equipped with higher power heating elements, which are also compatible with the original heating elements.

Documentation:

  • https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1KJxf2iRgSHsNmKo7WZtSNDlcbbzic_eU?usp=drive_link

products.title: Panchroma Satin PLA Rainbow 1.75mm 1kg Filament
products.body_html:
Panchroma™ Satin Rainbow PLA is a colour transition 3D printing filament that transitions between various colours and shades throughout the spool. Based on Polymakers Satin PLA formula, this rainbow filament combines ease of use, printing quality, speed and reliability. It is the perfect choice to easily create colourful or multi-shade models with a smooth satin surface finish that hides the layers.

Features

  • Gradient Transition - Panchroma™ Satin Gradient PLA combines the incredible satin surface finish of Panchroma™ Satin PLA (previously PolyTerra PLA+) with a series of stunning gradient colour transition filaments. Panchroma™ Satin Gradient PLA delivers a fun and colourful filament for hobbyists, educators and small businesses. Panchroma™ Satin Gradient PLA is the perfect choice for 3d printing vibrant vases, articulated models, statues and artistic creations.

  • Satin Surface Finish - Polymakers satin PLA formula renders parts with an attractive slight gloss surface finish which offers a nice effect for aesthetic models.

  • High Quality Raw Materials - Panchroma™ Satin Gradient PLA filament is made with the highest quality ingredients including Ingeo® from Natureworks. Natureworks is a world-leading biopolymers supplier based in the USA with a portfolio of high quality raw PLA materials produced from rapidly renewable plant resources. Combining Polymakers innovative R&D technologies, compounding and extrusion systems with Natureworks Ingeo® resins produces a reliable 3D printing filament to print beautiful and accurate models

  • Compatibility In Mind - Panchroma™ Satin Gradient PLA is compatible with a wide range of 3D printers and works well on most printing surface with a thin layer of glue stick applied, no heated bed is required but can sometimes be used at 40 - 60°C for better results (maximum 60°C).

  • Cardboard spool with coated edge - Panchroma filament comes in upgraded packaging, featuring an enhanced coating on the edge and a fully recycled cardboard spool and box. The hard edge not only prevents the dust from fraying cardboard but also protects the edge from deformation and delamination, ideal for some multi-material systems.

products.title: NSK GRS PS2 Grease (80g) for High-Speed & Medium to Low-Temperature applications
products.body_html:
NSK® GRS PS2 grease is specifically formulated for lower temperature, high-speed, and lighter-load applications. It is the standard choice for NSK® miniature linear guides, offering excellent performance in small equipment operating under light loads. Its unique composition ensures smooth operation even in cold environments, making it ideal for precision applications.

Key Features:

  • Superior Performance: Designed for high-speed and lower-temperature applications.
  • Optimal Compatibility: Recommended for NSK® miniature linear guides.
  • Versatile Use: Ideal for small equipment with light loads.
  • Wide Temperature Range: Operates efficiently from -50°C to 100°C.
  • Premium Composition: Formulated with a lithium soap base, synthetic oil, and mineral oil for enhanced lubrication and longevity.

products.title: Bondtech  OEM All Metal RIDGA (V2) Set
products.body_html:
Reduce the runout of the main drive gear on your Dual Drive extruder.

A very solid, reliable and improved solution from Bondtech that provides a slight improvement to the print surface quality.

Compatible with the following Open-Source extruders:

  • HextrudORT

Why a V2?

The OEM RIDGA V2 allows for ideal engagement between main gear and an 8T or 10T motor gear, while retaining a safe distance between the stepper motor and gear assembly.

  • 1x Secondary gear 1.75/5.0 mm
  • 2x 3x5x7 needle bearings
  • 1x 3x20mm shaft

products.title: Graphite Plate - Heatbed For Creality K1 / K1C / K1 Max
products.body_html:
Graphite heatbed for Creality K1 series printers by R3Men (part of Devil Design Team)

Note: This is advance upgrade, it require wiring up AC, before powering on please ensure product/wiring has been checked or installed by a license electrician. Please ensure you wire ground wiring to the cast bed, we recommend a external thermal fuse(125c-135c) for added safety.

Note: Order after 4th May 2025 (K1 Max has AC/Magnet Pre-Assembled, this have resulted in increase in price to account assembly cost), Future K1 will be pre-assembled once previous batch are sold through. Order after 11 August 2025, will include SSR for both K1 Max/K1 version. 

Documentation: https://store.dremc.com.au/products/graphite-plate-heatbed-upgrade-for-creality-k1-k1c-k1-max

Specification: 

  • Ultra-flat: within 0.1mm flatness
  • Edge to Edge AC Heater
  • No warping: bed stays super flat at 115C as well as at 60C. No need to heat soak the bed for long time like aluminum beds.
  • It is over 30% lighter than aluminum and heats faster. Huge improvement for K1/K1C/K1SE after upgrading to AC heater you shorten the heat to 100C time from around 5 minutes down to less than 2 minutes.
  • Works with Eddy current sensors (Cartographer, Beacon, BTT Eddy). Magnetic sheet and build plate are enough for eddy current sensor to work properly.

Note: Suitable for both 110V or 220V, for International customer, please contact us for documentation or check original R3Men documentation as wiring will depending on your local country or power AC you using your machine on. We will only note documentation for 220v. 

Graphite thermal expansion

  • Graphite is unique due to its thermal expansion properties (CTE). Typically, when a material or substance is heated, it expands. However, graphite has a remarkably low coefficient of thermal expansion.
  • Graphite thermal expansion coefficient is −1.4 × 10−6/°C to 1.1 × 10−6/°C from room temperature to 1350 °C

PTFE coating

  • PTFE thermal expansion coefficient is about 150 times higher than graphite. It is 151 x 10-6 per °C. It is even over 10 times higher than steel.
  • Coating graphite in PTFE may result in coating separation after heating cycles due to huge difference in CTE.
  • Our graphite beds are high purity graphite and they are not coated. They were tested for months in hundreds of heating cycles and showed no issues.


Part/Tools that Not Included, which you will need (For K1 / K1C / K1 SE)

  • Printed Parts & Hardware for below parts - See below Printable for more information
    • https://www.printables.com/model/1182770-bed-leveling-knob-for-m4-screw-m4-nut
    • https://www.printables.com/model/1182750-k1-k1c-k1se-ssr-mount-for-bed-heater-upgrade

Part/Tools that Not Included, which you will need (For K1 Max)

  • Printed Parts & Hardware for below parts - See below Printable for more information
    • https://www.printables.com/model/1182770-bed-leveling-knob-for-m4-screw-m4-nut

IMPORTANT:

  • If you wipe the graphite plate with alcohol or any liquid make sure that it is completely dry before gluing the heater and magnet!!! Graphite has pores and liquid will be trapped inside it and will make the glue bubble when heated. Please ensure you let the adhesive cure at least 24 hours with even pressure is applied on build plate/heater/magnet during the cure time . 
  • I suggest gluing the magnet on a 100C hot bed (the last step of installation) to make sure the graphite is dry and it glues flat. This was tested couple time and worked great. [Please take care, we recommended using heat resistant gloves when performing this step]

Shipping Note: 

We ship items in a flat cardboard sandwich box to prevent warping during transit. This item cannot be combined with non-flat items for shipping, so please expect additional freight costs when bundling it with smaller parts or filament. If we can bundle smaller items within the same box, we will update the shipping total before processing your payment. Otherwise, feel free to contact support for a customised quote.

General Note: You should never cut into AC heater pad. 

Preparation:

Before applying either the magnetic sheet(for steel flex plate) or silicone heater to the bottom side we recommend to scuff surface with steel wool and wipe clean with isopropyl alcohol (IPA) before application. For Graphite, ensure the surface is completely dried before applying anything onto build plate such as AC Pad or Magnet. 

More Info: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vZx4vfevwx4

More Info AC Pad Install/FAQ: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000302252-keenovo-ac-heater-faq

Note

  • To make sure the optimum performance for this heater is achievable, both temperature sensing and control elements should installed to controller.

Caution

  • The Heater Mat is not suitable for stand-alone operation.
  • Do not cut into the heater pad
  • Ensure proper strain relief on wiring and proper grounding of the cast bed.

Warning

  • These heaters shall only be used where adequate electrical, thermal and mechanical barriers are provided to prevent access to hazardous parts without the use of a tool.

products.title: Nevermore StealthMax Complete Hardware Kit for 3D Printer Air Filtration
products.body_html:
This is the Nevermore StealthMax, the biggest and meanest DIY carbon filtration system designed specifically for 3D printers. This product is provided by the thoughtful design of 0ndsk4.

For details about the product visit: https://github.com/nevermore3d/StealthMax

Please note - this is a complete kit of parts to build a Nevermore StealthMax except for the actual carbon medium and printed parts, you'll need to do that. If you need the carbon we sell Nevermore Carbon here.

Note: The other option is using Isik's Tech PCB for electronics, otherwise the kit does include step down module from 24v to 12v and 5v for the Pico and Fan. 

Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hYod_lFw8lQ

Required bed size is at least 300x300 (StealthMax)

The Nevermore StealthMax is an air filter developed specifically for 3D printers. It uses activated carbon and HEPA filters, designed to filter and absorb harmful fumes and unpleasant odors generated when plastics are melted, creating a safer and more comfortable environment for users, purifying the air and protecting health.

Features: 

  1. The interior is filled with 4mm columnar activated carbon, which can effectively absorb harmful gases such as volatile organic compounds (VOC);
  2. It is also equipped with a HEPA (High Efficiency Particulate Air) filter, which can effectively capture tiny particles with a diameter of 2.5 microns and below (usually much smaller in 3D printing) and filter the tiny particles generated during the printing process;
  3. The use of Raspberry Pi Pico W Wifi wireless module makes installation and operation simpler and more convenient;
  4. Add a 12V step-down module. The device can be directly powered by 24V without a separate 12V power supply;
  5. Each module has been soldered with pin headers and circuits, and can be plugged in and used directly without re-soldering.

    Why choose Gates RF belts

    • Their special 3-ply construction gives the best of all worlds: the nylon tooth facing material increases lubricity of the belt surface, fiberglass tensile cord adds exceptional strength and resistance to stretching, and a neoprene body ensures a supple and flexible surface that won't crack or deform, even in high heat printers. RF has dust proof coating on belt to improve longevity, especially in Australia.

products.title: E3D High Flow HTA Complete Hotend for Bambu Lab X1E
products.body_html:
E3D are very proud to be the only officially approved manufacturer of aftermarket Bambu Lab HotEnds! These High Flow HTA (High Temperature Abrasive Resistant) HotEnds were developed in collaboration with Bambu Lab.

Upgrade Guide: https://wiki.bambulab.com/en/x1/maintenance/x1e-toolhead

Professional HotEnds for professional applications; improve the efficiency of your X1E and the finish of your prints with this simple upgrade.

High Flow. There's no denying that the Bambu Lab X1E printer is built for speed. However, the motion system, as remarkable as it is, has headroom to be even better. That's where E3D High Flow technology comes in. Using our internal nozzle modification, we've managed to increase the volumetric flow rate of the HotEnd by 60%! That means you can expect more reliable and consistent extrusion at the same speeds or bump up the volumetric flow rate limit in the slicer to utilize the motion system's capabilities fully.

Hard And Hot. These HotEnds are coated with Chromium Nitride to provide additional abrasive resistance and corrosion prevention properties up to 320°C. Perfect for printing engineering-grade materials such as PPA-CF and PPS-CF at faster print speeds. Alternatively, maintain your stock profiles and experience improved interlayer adhesion.

Improved Layer Adhesion. High-speed printing often sacrifices visual and functional aspects in favor of speed, but these HotEnds maintain interlayer adhesion strength even at higher speeds, resulting in the correct filament finish and strong parts for functional applications. Don't just take our word for it though - check out this video from Printing Perspective where he puts it to the test!

No Compromise. These HotEnds are a drop-in replacement for your stock X1E HotEnd, no adjustment to the mount or part cooling is required. Complete the upgrade in under 5 mins with our installation video guide.

Some filled materials contain particles that are close to, if not larger than, some of the smaller industry-standard nozzle sizes, including up to 0.4mm. Attempting to print such materials through these nozzle sizes significantly increases the risk of a jam. Please check your filament manufacturer’s datasheet for recommended minimum nozzle orifice diameter to ensure that the nozzle/hotend you choose is suitable for your use case.

Compatibility:

  • This HotEnd is only for use with Bambu Lab X1E.

Supported Filaments:

Optimal: PLA, PETG, TPU, PVA, BVOH

Superior: ABS, ASA, PC, PA, PET, Carbon/Glass Fiber Reinforced PLA, PETG, PA, PET, PC, ABS, ASA

Ideal: PPA-CF/GF, PPS, PPS-CF/GF

Features: 

  • Filament diameter: 1.75mm
  • Compatibility: Bambu Lab X1E
  • Maximum temperature: 320°C
  • Drop-in repalcement HotEnd for Bambu X1E
  • 60% additional flow rate when compared to the standard Bambu Lab HotEnd!
  • High flow and high-temperature printing in one.
  • Officially approved & licensed Bambu Lab product.

Please note:
Some filled materials contain particles close to, if not larger than, some of the smaller industry standard nozzle sizes, including up to 0.4mm. Attempting to print such materials through these nozzle sizes significantly increases the risk a jam. Please check your filament manufacturer’s datasheet for recommended minimum nozzle orifice diameter to ensure that the nozzle/hotend you choose is suitable for your use case

products.title: LDO MGN9H Linear Rail with Carriage 300/350/400 (Precision H)
products.body_html:
LDO is famous for their quality components and these linear rails are no exception, with super smooth operation you will have rails that don't have that dreaded crunch like the cheap ones you find elsewhere.

This is high precision guide way and carriage will offer better dimensional tolerance compare to typical rails standard/normal precision rails and offering ~40% better parallelism. Stainless 440c rails/carriages/balls ensure no rusting occurs in humid environments. 

Suitable for Voron 2.4/Trident Y/Z Axis, always best to measure or check printer BOM size to ensure compatible. Suitable for other DIY/Custom printers, size depend on your printer.

products.title: Fysetc H36 V1.3 Combo Compatible with NEMA14/36mm Motor
products.body_html:
H36 Combo is a newly designed high temperature tool board running Klipper firmware. Based on STMG0B1T3, the maximum operating temperature can reach 125 degrees Celsius (CAN only). It also provides two communication methods: CANBUS and USB. The onboard USB HUB has up to two USB interfaces (or one CAN and one USB), which can be used to connect to the IDM Scanner Levelling Sensor camera, etc.

Orders after 22/04/25 are shipping V1.3 (with ADXL345)

Documentation: 

  • Resources: https://github.com/FYSETC/H36_Combo
  • Wiki: https://wiki.fysetc.com/docs/H36-Combo

Features:

  • STM32G0B1T3 MCU, up to 125 degrees Celsius, supports Klipper Firmware 
  • 6-layer PCB design, all solid capacitors and tantalum capacitors, better heat dissipation 
  • Onboard IO controlled CAN/USB switch, 
  • Onboard RESET and BOOT0 buttons for easy firmware update 
  • Fan control/heating both use independent high-power MOS, safer and lower heat generation 
  • Onboard 5V@3A DC-DC, 5V peak load can reach 15W 
  • XT30 interface, custom cable comes with the board 
  • Onboard USB2.0 HUB, 3x USB2.0 interface (one of which is connected to MCU) 
  • Support CAN / USB2.0 connection 
  • Onboard TMC2209 
  • 3x 3pin Fans, 3x IO with level converter, 1x RGB,1x Heat, 1x thermistor,1x status LED 
  • ADXL345 Accelerometer onboard 
  • USB-C onboard for Firmware update

The onboard USBHUB has up to three USB interfaces, which can be used to connect to the scanning levelling sensor (Scanner Levelling Sensor ,such as Cartographer) or camera, etc. It can also be connected vertically with an optional board for easy use.

products.title: Magigoo Flex 3D Printing Adhesive 50ml for Flexible Materials
products.body_html:
MAGIGOO Flex is designed for professional use, to work exclusively with TPU (thermoplastic polyurethane), TPE (thermoplastic elastomer and TPC (thermoplastic copolyester) filaments. The part should be relatively easy to remove once it cools and the glue residue should also be easily cleaned off.
 
TPUs, TPEs/TPCs describe a group of polymers which are sometimes referred to as thermoplastic rubbers. Thermoplastic rubbers exist as co-polymers or a polymer blend, generally of a plastic and a rubber. This imparts both thermoplastic and elastomeric properties. As a result these materials have the advantage of being able to stretch to moderate elongations and returning to the original shape. 

Additionally these materials have very good thermal properties, material stability, chemical resistance, and are more cost effective to produce. As a result these materials are highly sought in industrial applications.

Some flexible filaments show lower adhesion to conventional 3D-printing build surfaces and a high tendency to warp. Others tend to stick too well to bare 3D printing surfaces such as glass and PEI. MAGIGOO Flex is a specialised solution for FDM printing of flexible filaments which was developed to work with a wide number of flexible filament types. MAGIGOO Flex acts as an intermediate layer between the build-plate and the printed part enabling good adhesion and facilitating print removal as required. 

Additional Information: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000287772-magigoo-instruction-manual

products.body_html:
Ceramic hotend assembly engineered as a direct replacement for Anycubic Kobra 3 printers. This sourced from Fysetc unit features a TZ nozzle configuration, delivering enhanced thermal stability and improved material flow characteristics paired with harden steel nozzle for better wear resistant compared to stock hotend. 

What is Included: 

  • 1x Aftermarket Ceramic Hotend (0.4mm) for Kobra 3
  • 1x Nozzle Wrench Tool

Note: You require to use existing cold end/heat sink from your existing printer.

Features

  • Compatible with Anycubic Kobra 3 3D Printer.
  • Note: This hotend use TZ Nozzle
  • Supports a range of filament types including PLA, PETG, ABS, TPU and more!

Other Spares: 

  • Heater + Thermistor 
  • Silicon Sock
  • TZ Nozzle (Harden Steel)
  • TZ Nozzle (Bi Metal Harden Steel + Copper)

Specifications

  • Nozzle Size: 0.4mm TZ Nozzle (Harden Steel Nozzle)
  • Maximum Operating Temperature: Up to 280°C (up to 350°c without sock)
  • Filament Diameter Compatibility: 1.75mm.
  • Components Included: Hotend assembly, heating cartridge, thermistor, mounting screws, and installation manual.

Documentation: 

How to Replace Hotend: https://wiki.anycubic.com/en/fdm-3d-printer/kobra-3-combo/hotend-replacement-guide

Note 1: Hot Tightening Nozzle 

  • We highly recommended hot you hot tighten nozzle and PID autotune before use. We recommend setting to max printing temperature that printer supports. Documentation: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000318231-how-to-hot-tighten-nozzle-change-a-nozzle (If you have issues with your first layer, adjust gcode first layer offset value and its recommended you re-tune your materials flow ratio) 

Note 2: Harden Nozzle Note

  • As its harden steel nozzle, you will need increase printing temperature compare to stock brass nozzle hotend, usually 10-20c more or you will need reduce printing speed or max flow rate. 

Note 3: Change Nozzle

  • Pre-installed nozzle has thread lock pre-applied at the factory, you are require to heat up above 250c to loosen thread lock to swap/change nozzle. Ensure you wrench to hold the heater block in place so its does not twist. Note: Recommenced is max 1.5nm when tightening/loosening to prevent snapping nozzle, although over time due to heat cycling materials (harden steel) can become more brittle over time (aging) starting with lower torque where possible is recommended.

products.title: Bigtreetech Scylla V1.0 - CNC Control Board
products.body_html:
Scylla is a high powered control board collaboration between Millennium Machines and BIGTREETECH

Developed by BIGTREETECH in collaboration with Millennium Machines, Scylla delivers unprecedented precision and reliability for the most demanding CNC enthusiasts. Designed to excel in speed, stability, and accuracy, Scylla empowers you to revolutionise your projects.

Key Features:

  • ARM Cortex-M7 STM32H723VGT6 MCU @ 550Mhz
  • Supports RRF 3.5+ (with enough free memory for MillenniumOS! 😅 )
  • Passive cooling with integrated heatsink
  • Separate, high current voltage inputs for Motors and Auxiliary (MOS) circuits
  • V-MOTOR - DC 24-60v, 10A max
  • V-MCU - DC 24-60v, 3A max
  • V-MOS - DC 24-60v, 10A max
  • All high-voltage circuits fully opto-isolated and fused
  • 4 x Integrated Trinamic TMC 2160 Motor Drivers (X,Y, Z, A axes)
  • 4.7A RMS / 6.7A Peak
  • Passive cooling with integrated heatsink
  • +5V DC  ENA, STEP and DIR headers for external driver control
  • Flexible Endstops / Inputs
  • Endstops powered at 5v, 12v or V-MOS
  • Probe and Toolsetter ports individually selectable between 5v, 12v or V-MOS, with jumpers to select NPN or PNP
  • Fully integrated Digital and Analog Spindle Control
  • Enable and Direction  MOSFET-Switched outputs:
  • Powered (5v, 12v or V-MOS, max 4.5A) or
  • Unpowered.
  • Digital (PWM) or Analog (0-5v, 0-10v) Speed signals
  • Digital or Analog selectable by jumper
  • Unpowered, requires voltage source - usually a reference port on VFD.
  • Combine or separate grounds between Enable / Direction and Speed signals, for improved compatibility with different VFDs and simpler wiring
  • Integrated RS485 Transceiver
  • Control your VFD using Modbus over RS485, with feedback! (Pending software integration with RRF)
  • RS485 source can be switched between MCU and SBC
  • Integrated CAN Transceiver
  • 120Ω termination resistor with jumper-select
  • Extensive Auxiliary port configurations for cooling, solenoids and fans
  • 1 x 250v / 10A max Relay, NO
  • 3 x MOSFET-switched auxiliary circuits at V-MOS - 3A max
  • 1 x Coolant, 1 x Mist MOSFET-switched circuits at V-MOS - 1A max
  • 2.4GHz WiFi connectivity by ESP32-WROOM-32E-N4
  • RGB Connector at 5V
  • MillenniumOS supported

Documentation: 

  • Documentation for RRF
  • Github

Manufacturer Information:

products.title: Bigtreetech MMB Cubic V1.0 Mainboard Expansion Board
products.body_html:
MMB Cubic allows you to add more fans, thermistors and heater outputs to your klipper 3d printer via a small compact board. 

Features:

  • BTT MMB Cubic Klipper toolboard employs a 32-bit ARM Cortex-M0+ RP2040 MCU, operating at 133 MHz. It adopts the LN5016-1.5A power chip, supporting a 24V (max: 36V) power input and is capable of delivering a maximum output current of 1.5A.
  • A specially designed circuit on the board protects the signal coming back from the thermistor, preventing MCU damage from shorted heated beds and heater cartridge connections.
  • The PWM fan includes a range of selectable voltage options: 24V/12V/5V, which eliminates the need for external voltage modules and reduces the risk of damage to the board. 

Specification:

  • Microprocessor: ARM Cortex-M0+ STM32GOB1RET6 64MHz
  • Input Voltage: DC12V-DC24V 9A
  • Logic Voltage: DC 3.3V
  • Servo Interface(MOT)Maximum Output: 5V 2A，peak 2.5A
  • Expansion Interfaces: STP1-STP11,12C, RGB, Sensor (infrared sensor interface), USB，CAN
  • Motor Driver Support: Z Drive (supports voltage selection)
  • Driver Operating Modes: STEP/DIR，UART， SPI
  • Stepper Motor Interfaces: M1, M2, M3,M4
  • USB Communication Interface: USB Type-C
  • DCDC 5V Output Maximum Current: 3.6A

Documentation: 

  • Github: https://github.com/bigtreetech/MMB-Cubic

products.title: Polymaker Panchroma™ Celestial PLA
products.body_html:
High quality pastel metallic series of Polymaker™ Celestial PLA colours delivering a bright shimmery metallic effect.

  • High quality Polymaker Celestial PLA.
  • Bright colourful glitter range with a delicate shimmering effect.
  • Easy-to-print.
  • Great rigidity, tensile strength and inter-layer adhesion.
  • Consistent colour and tolerance (1.75mm diameter +/- 0.03mm)
This spool fits in the A1 / X1 AMS system and has a coated edge.

Panchroma™ Celestial is a beautiful pastel color with glitter powder shining through the translucency of the material.

Print Designers and Design Files:

Designer: Holoprops
Designs:
Crystal Phone Stand
Crystal Decoration for Desk
Crystal Nintendo Stand

Designer: Cynderwing
Design: Alicorn Dragon

Features

  • Shimmery Metallic Effect - Panchroma™ Celestial PLA delivers beautiful range of pastel colours with a pearlescent glitter powder that shines through the translucency of the PLA material. Celestial PLA's shimmery surface finish helps to hide the layer lines; delivering a beautiful and colourful filament for aesthetic vases, figurines, cosplay props, puzzles and articulated models.

  • High Quality Raw Materials - Panchroma™ Celestial PLA filament is made with the highest quality ingredients including Ingeo® from Natureworks. Natureworks is a world-leading biopolymers supplier based in the USA with a portfolio of high quality raw PLA materials produced from rapidly renewable plant resources. Combining Polymakers innovative R&D technologies, compounding and extrusion systems with Natureworks Ingeo® resins produces a reliable 3D printing filament to print beautiful and accurate models

  • Compatibility In Mind - Panchroma™ Celestial PLA is compatible with a wide range of 3D printers and works well on most printing surface with a thin layer of glue stick applied, no heated bed is required but can sometimes be used at 40 - 60°C for better results (maximum 60°C).

  • Cardboard spool with coated edge - Panchroma filament comes in upgraded packaging, featuring an enhanced coating on the edge and a fully recycled cardboard spool and box. The hard edge not only prevents the dust from fraying cardboard but also protects the edge from deformation and delamination, ideal for some multi-material systems.

products.title: Bondtech Coated Copper CHT Nozzle FIN
products.body_html:
• Low Thermal expansion for improved seal pressure.
  • Better Silicone boot heat block and nozzle interlock for lower print interference.
  • Better thermal insulation for superior air cooling deflection.
  • Unbeatable melt capacity for market leading volumetric flow.
  • Low mass for improved heat conduction and thermal performance.

FIN Nozzle Standard

  • Adopting the Free and open-source Insulated Nozzle (FIN) Standard, an evolution of the widely respected RepRap (V6) Standard, we present the new Bondtech CHT FIN nozzles.
  • With a 6 mm hex for easy interchangeability, the FIN Standard features an innovative nozzle geometry that interlocks with the silicone boot, fully insulating the hotend and shielding it from cool air and plastic.
  • Bondtech has embraced the FIN Standard, offering top-performing CHT nozzles in this new format.

Superior Thermal Performance

  • These low mass, Nickel coated Copper nozzles are the perfect option for using on the Mako hotend on all compatible Bambu Lab 3D printers, when you are pursuing increased speeds and top melting capacity and volumetric flow.
  • Superior heat conduction and thermal performance for non-abrasive filaments that bring to you consistent and high-quality results with every print.

products.title: Gates Powergrip® RF 2GT Belt for Anycubic-  Kobra 3 Series
products.body_html:
Replacement Pre-Crimped Belts for Anycubic Kobra 3 or 3 Max, using Gates PowerGrip RF for improve reliability, pre-cut to length and terminated with custom copper ferrules for plug and play replacement. 

Why choose Gates RF belts

  • Their special 3-ply construction gives the best of all worlds: the nylon tooth facing material increases lubricity of the belt surface, fiberglass tensile cord adds exceptional strength and resistance to stretching, and a neoprene body ensures a supple and flexible surface that won't crack or deform, even in high heat printers. RF has dust proof coating on belt to improve longevity, especially in Australia. 

If you don't see your belt here and need a specific length, please open a support ticket and we'll be happy to assist or check our other product collection for other printer models. 

Specification: 

  • Belt Materials Gates LL-2GT-6 RF
  • The length varies according to the chosen option and is indicated in the SKU—for example, the length is highlighted in bold in LL-2GT-6-RF-819.

Compatibility Note: 

Depending on your selection

  • Kobra 3 Max

Note 1: Depending on length, gates label may not be present on pre-crimped belt as label only appear every 1500mm. Our belts are cut roughly 1-2 mm longer compare to Creality specs. Copper sleeves as shown in product photo may vary between batches.

What is Included:

This is the 14-pin Umbilical cable that connect the Frame and Toolhead PCBs together. We have sourced this using 20AWG UL1332 (200C 300V) wire, neatly wrapped in a cable loom that terminates neatly into heatshrink. Pin-to-Pin measurement is 240mm.

products.title: LDO Klipper ToolBoard for E3D Roto Extruder
products.body_html:
Explore the advanced capabilities of smarter extrusion with the Roto Klipper ToolBoard, designed by Robert Lorincz. This ToolBoard simplifies your wiring setup and introduces features like input shaping directly onto the Toolboard.

Please note that this Toolboard does not come with the Roto Extruder, you can buy that seperately here.

Roto ready

Optimized to work directly with the Roto Extruder, this Klipper compatible Toolboard mounts directly to the Roto allowing for compact simple wiring using the automotive grade USB interface. To protect against electrical hazards the Toolboard is supplied with an adaptor board which has onboard protection circuits to safeguard the Raspberry PI USB port.

Adaptability 
With flexibility and futureproofing in mind, the board accepts both thermistor and PT1000 inputs, meaning you can use both the standard Revo Heater Cores and the High Temperature Hotsides. This allows a maximum print temperature of 500C (for details about ambient and actively heated chambers, refer to the datasheet).

Safety focused 

The Roto Klipper Toolboard is built around Robert’s design philosophy of robustness and safeguarding against common user errors and 3D printer defects, taking inspiration from the automotive industry, where protection against hazards is paramount. For a more detailed deep dive into the protections in place, please refer to the datasheet.

⚠️ WARNING: This product can expose you to chemicals including Mineral Oils, which is known to the State of California to cause cancer, and Lead and Nickel, which are known to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm.

products.title: Creality Hyper Rainbow PLA 3D Printing Filament 1kg
products.body_html:
Creality Hyper Rainbow PLA 3D Printing Filament delivers strikingly vivid and realistic prints. Crafted from premium materials, this 1kg spool ensures smooth and reliable printing performance.

Features: 

  • Vibrant Gradients,
  • Cardboard spool and packaging
  • Vacuum sealed bag
  • Diameter: 1.75mm (+/- 0.03mm)
  • Net weight: 1KG
  • Density: 1.25 g/cm3

Rainbow Note: Please take note that rainbow filaments exhibit variations in colour and colour length with each batch/roll. Therefore, the photos displayed on this site may not accurately represent the exact colour you will receive. If you require a precise colour match, we advise against purchasing this product as it may lead to disappointment. Rainbow filament is ideal for creating large prints that desire a rainbow effect, such as vases. However, when printing small objects, the filament will likely produce only one colour. If you wish to achieve a rainbow effect on small objects, it is necessary to print multiple items on the same bed, allowing the rainbow effect to be spread across all objects. 

Printing Settings

Nozzle Temperature 190°C - 230°C
Build Plate Temperature 50°C - 60°C*
Build Surface Material Works well with most common build surfaces.
Build Surface Treatment Typically none required. Some surfaces such as glass work best with PVA glue stick or Magigoo .
Cooling Fan ON
Printing Speed 20 mm/s - 50 mm/s
Retraction The ideal retraction settings vary from printer to printer. If you find the retraction settings are causing gaps in your part, the following settings may help.
Direct Drive: Retraction distance of 0.5 - 1mm with retraction speed of 20mm/s
Bowden: Retraction distance of 2 - 3mm with retraction speed of 20 - 40mm/s
Drying Recommendation ~50°c for 4-6hrs (Only dry if filament is wet, over drying/repeat drying can damage filament) (Filament Dryer Guide)
Storage Keeping filament in an airtight container with new/dried desiccant.
Support Material

Single Extrusion:
Self Support

Idex/Tool Changer:
DREMC PVA

Based on 0.4 mm nozzle. Printing conditions may vary with different printers and nozzle diameters.

Note: Sample photo and marketing is provided by Creality.

products.title: E3D Roto Extruder Internals Kit - Vitamins
products.body_html:
The Roto Vitamins kit allows you to integrate the advanced lightweight gearbox from our Roto Direct Drive Extruder into your own toolhead, enhancing print quality. It replaces the SLM 3D-printed metal heatsink with a customizable printed plastic cover, simplifying adaptation across diverse machines. This design maintains full compatibility with our specialised Roto filament sensors and toolboards.

Roto Vitamins Datasheet

What's In The Box

  • 1 x Roto Gearbox Assembly
  • 1 x Roto Hobb Gear Kit
  • 1 x Bowden Collet
  • 1 x Dowel D1 L18
  • 1 x Dowel D3 L18

Printer Compatibility

  • Voron V0
  • Voron 2.4 / Trident (Stealth Burner)

Lightweight Yet Full Of Force 

The Roto gearbox features a planetary first stage, followed by a spur second stage and a dual hobbed third stage. This configuration delivers sufficient extrusion force to maximize the volumetric flow rates of our Revo High Flow nozzles while offering a reliable motor stall failure mode. The versatility of Roto Vitamins also allows it to be compatible with various non-E3D HotEnds.

Automatically Tensioned 

Roto Vitamins incorporates a straightforward bi-stable idler mechanism that delivers ideal tension for printing various filaments and fully releases tension to facilitate filament unloading and cold pulls. This design enables one-handed nozzle changes and filament release. The kit also includes a 1mm dowel pin, creating a smooth ramp for the idler clip to glide over, preserving this functionality while permitting the front cover to be produced via FDM 3D printing.

Additional Upgrades 

Explore E3D Toolboard and filament monitoring options to enhance your hands-off printing experience. 

Perfectly Paired With Voron 

E3D have designed several mounts for easy integration with Voron printers, check them out here. There are also some base designs available for you to integrate into whatever system you have!

products.title: Cartographer3D CNC Toolhead Mount - Colour Edition
products.body_html:
Experience precision like never before with our Ultra-Light CNC'ed Mount, meticulously designed for seamless integration with the StealthBurner and Cartographer3D Probe.  

Note - Unfortunately this mount is not compatible with the Monalith Gantry system due to the fact it uses a reversed belt path.

Now available for both 6mm only in colour variant, and with 8.5mm UHF extenders

 Key Features:

  • Compatibility: Expertly tailored to fit both StealthBurner and the Cartographer3D Probe, offering a versatile solution for your printer.
  • Lightweight Design: Made from high-grade 6061 aluminum, this CNC'ed mount is ultra-lightweight at 25.7 grams, yet incredibly durable, enhancing the efficiency of your equipment without adding extra bulk.
  • Precision Engineering: CNC machining ensures precise dimensions and an impeccable fit, guaranteeing stability and reliability in every use.
  • Versatile Rail Compatibility: Designed to mount effortlessly on both MGN9 and MGN12 rails, providing unparalleled adaptability for various setups.
  • Easy Installation: Intuitive design allows for quick and hassle-free installation, enabling you to get up and running in no time.
  • Rigidity - Our CNC StealthBurner mount adds a level of rigidity not possible with printed parts. 
  • Enhanced Stability: The robust construction ensures that your StealthBurner and Cartographer3D Probe remain securely in place, delivering consistent accuracy during operation.

Included:

  • 1 x Cartographer3D CNC StealthBurner Mount
  • 2 x Belt Clamps and Bolts

Compatibility

products.title: Micro Swiss FlowTech™ Hotend for Sovol SV08
products.body_html:
This kit features a plug-and-play hotend, Heater Core, and thermistor, all fully compatible with the Sovol SV08 printer. It preserves the original z-height, build volume, and firmware without any alterations.

By upgrading your Sovol SV08 to a FlowTech ecosystem, you can utilise a comprehensive range of FlowTech, leak-proof nozzles. These nozzles include the DiamondBack, CHT High Flow, and CM2 Hardened tip nozzles.

Made in USA by Microswiss

Features:

  • Leak-Proof Nozzle:
    Tired of messy nozzle leaks that ruin your prints and waste filament? FlowTech Hotend combines nozzle and thermal break into one permanently sealed assembly that ensures a leak-proof hotend.

  • Cold Nozzle Change:
    Swapping out nozzles used to be a time-consuming and potentially hazardous task. With a FlowTech Hotend, nozzle changes are effortless, and there's no need for hot tightening, and you can do it with just one hand.

  • High-Flow Characteristics:
    Ceramic cylindrical heater and 28.6mm melt zone provides excellent volumetric flow rate.

  • All-Metal Design:
    Built to last! FlowTech hotend features an all-metal design that can handle most modern 3D printing filaments. The entire hotend is machined and assembled in-house, with quality control performed at multiple stages during the manufacturing process. At the end, each hotend undergoes a full thermal cycling test before it is packaged.

  • 300°C Max Temperature:
    This hotend is rated at 300°C temperature with a properly tuned NTC thermistor for each specific printer. This particular edition is perfectly tuned for Sovol SV08 so no firmware changes are needed.

Supported Printers:

  • Sovol SV08

 What is Included:

  • 1x FlowTech™ Heater Core
  • 1x Heatsink
  • 1x FlowTech™ Brass Plated 0.4mm Nozzle
  • 2x Titanium Mounting Screws
  • 1x Silicon Sock

Documentation:

products.title: West3D's Undertaker Tungsten Carbide Nozzle
products.body_html:
This is the famous Undertaker Nozzle from West3D, straight from the source!

No tricks, all tungsten carbide (TC)!

Sold Individually

What to expect

  • V6 nozzle that fits most standard hotends (please check compatibility!), MK8 suitable for most older Creality (non K1) and volcano will suitable for hotend with Volcano hotends
  • Full body tungsten carbide. Not "just the tip"!
  • Good thermal conductivity compare to harden steel.
  • Extremely hard! There is barely any filaments that can touch this nozzle!
  • Polished surface finish for nice looks and less filament sticking

How to use?

  • Slap on your printer
  • Hot tighten as usual
  • Print every filament (almost)

Disclaimer

Even though this nozzle is extremely hard, there might still be materials that will wear it.
It's come to our attention that there is "Boron Carbide" filament for as cheap as 1500 AUD that can wear tungsten carbide.


If you are one of those people, expect that this nozzle will not last forever.

Compatibility:

  • The V6 Style nozzle works with most standard hot ends (non Creality/MK8 style)
  • The MK8 Style nozzle works with many non K1 style Creality printers such as the CR10 / Ender / CHCB-OTetc.
  • The Volcano nozzle will work most volcano heater block or hotends. 
  • The Bambu Style works with most aftermarket Bambu Style hot ends (e.g. TZ2) that have a removable nozzle. Not suitable A1 style of TZ hotends.

products.title: Magigoo Pro HT 3D Printing Adhesive for High Temperature Materials 50ml
products.body_html:
Magigoo Pro HT is designed for professional use, to work at high printing temperatures. The part should be relatively easy to remove once it cools and the glue residue should also be easily cleaned off. 

High temperature materials such as PEEK are advanced engineering thermoplastics which offer improved mechanical and chemical stability at elevated temperatures when compared to regular thermoplastics. Other materials include PEKK, Ultem and PPSU and their carbon/glass fibre reinforced counterparts. Owing to their high temperature and other exceptional properties these materials are highly sought after in high temperature and high performance engineering applications such as in the automotive and aerospace industries. Additionally these material are also sought after in the chemical, petrochemical, medical and research applications.

High temperature filaments prove to be challenging materials for FDM printing due to their higher tendency to warp. These materials are generally printed at elevated temperatures owing to their high temperature properties. Magigoo Pro HT is a specialized solution for FDM printing of PEEK filaments which was developed to work at elevated printing temperatures.

Important note

Using this product with other than PEEK type filaments might cause over adhesion and damage your build surface.

The applicator has an active spring valve, which activates when applicator is pressed against the build plate. Please do not press the bottle as "ketchup bottle" , otherwise the applicator may pop off. Bottle may be slightly squeezed, only when the nib is pressed against the bed and it may be necessary only if bigger flow is required. Bottle must not be squeezed when cap is off any other time as it may result in glue popping out of the bottle.

Additional Information: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000287772-magigoo-instruction-manual

Magigoo Pro HT compatibility

  • Solvay KetaSpire PEEK
  • Essentium PEEK
  • Arkema / Kimya / 3DXTech PVDF
  • Other PEEK and PEKK and similar materials

products.title: Magigoo PP 50ml 3D Printing Adhesive
products.body_html:
Magigoo PP is a professional adhesive made for polypropylene filaments. It ensures easy part removal and simple cleaning when used as directed.

Polypropylene (PP) is a semi-crystalline thermoplastic known for its impact resistance and flexibility. Its non-polar molecular structure offers strong chemical resistance, making it suitable for applications such as food packaging and medical devices. Due to its partial crystallinity and the inherent difficulty of bonding polyolefin materials to other surfaces, PP is challenging to 3D print. Magigoo PP addresses these challenges by improving adhesion and simplifying the FDM 3D printing process.

Caution when using! Contact with eyes causes serious eye damage. Wash hands and exposed skin thoroughly after handling.

Important note

Using this product with other than PP type filaments might cause over adhesion and damage your build surface.

The applicator has an active spring valve, which activates when applicator is pressed against the build plate. Please do not press the bottle as "ketchup bottle" , otherwise the applicator may pop off. Bottle may be slightly squeezed, only when the nib is pressed against the bed and it may be necessary only if bigger flow is required. Bottle must not be squeezed when cap is off any other time as it may result in glue popping out of the bottle.

Additional Information: https://support.dremc.com.au/en/support/solutions/articles/51000287772-magigoo-instruction-manual

products.title: Provok3d NanoFlow™ Tungsten Carbide V6 Nozzle (0.5mm)
products.body_html:
The NanoFlow™ Nozzle has a special internal design that improves filament flow, making extrusion smoother and reducing clogs. It also enhances heat transfer, helping filament melt evenly during printing. The nozzle is coated with a durable nano layer that resists heat, abrasion, and corrosion up to 1000°C, which also helps prevent filament from sticking, especially with high-temperature materials.


Features: 

  • Advanced Geometric Design: The NanoFlow™ Nozzle is engineered with a unique internal geometry that optimizes the flow of melted filament. This design significantly minimizes back pressure, in turn reducing required extrusion force, ensuring smoother, more reliable extrusion and reducing the risk of clogs or jams.
  • Enhanced Heat Transfer: Our nozzle doesn’t just excel at reducing back pressure; it’s also a champion of heat transfer. The special geometry facilitates better heat transfer within the melt zone. This means the filament reaches its ideal viscosity more evenly and maintains it throughout the printing process.
  • Nano Coating Technology: The NanoFlow™ Nozzle is treated with a cutting-edge nano coating rated to thrive in temperatures up to 1000°C (MAX). This robust coating is highly abrasion and corrosion resistant, boasting a hardness from 3200 to 3400 HV. Its also reducing the likelihood of filament sticking to the nozzle. This is especially beneficial when working with high-temperature materials

Package Contains:

  • 1x Nano coated tungsten carbide (TC) nozzle 

Specification:

  • Grade K20/WC 94%
  • Hardness(HRA)  >90.00

Coating

  • 3200–3400 HV
  • μ 0.15
  • Max temp 1000°C

products.title: E3D PZ Probe™ Kit / Voron Cold Side
products.body_html:
Engineered exclusively for the Voron Stealth burner, the Revo PZ Probe™ Voron embeds a bed levelling mechanism within the Revo Voron Heatsink. This innovation converts your Revo nozzle into a bed probe seamlessly, maintaining the original form factor.

Easy PZ Probing

PZ Probe is a piezoelectric element which converts vibrations into electrical signals and is triggered upon contact between the nozzle and the print bed. With PZ Probe you only need to calibrate your z offset once to accommodate for flexibility in your motion system, after that simply screw in (with only your fingers) a new nozzle, and PZ Probe does all the hard work for you…. Easy PZ!

Lightweight

Weighing in under 40g including the heatsink & cables, PZ Probe ensures that this set-up is significantly lighter than any other Stealth burner tool head and bed levelling sensor combo.

Perfect first layer

Using the Revo nozzle as probe ensures a precise bed levelling mesh, leading to a clean first layer, the pre-requisite of any successful 3D print.

Easy Integration

The only new part to add to your existing Stealthburner set-up is a Flat Flex Cable, read more here about this super simple step. Check out SteveBuilds mount here, note that you will need 2 extra printed parts if you opt for this mount.

Read more technical and FAQ information in E3D  documentation .

Compatibility :

  • Revo PZ Probe Voron is compatible with Voron Stealth burner.

Please note : Make sure to read the technical datasheet in its entirety prior to installing the PZ Probe.

Kit includes:

(PZ Probe Only):

  • 1 x PZ washer
  • 2 x M2 Board Mounting Screws
  • 1 x PZ Probe Board
  • 1 x Extension cables

(Revo PZ Probe Voron) :

  • 1 x Revo Voron Heatsink with an integrated Piezo
  • 2 x M2 Board Mounting Screws
  • 1 x PZ Probe Board
  • 1 x Extension cables
  • 1 x Bowden tubing

Pair with your perfect Hotside

Pair your Revo Voron Coldside with one of our carefully curated Hotside packs to ensure your printing needs are met, straight out of the box. All Hotside packs come with your heating and sensing elements plus a variety of nozzles for you to start quick swapping with. Select from the following options:  

  • Starter  - Ideal for users printing at standard speeds with PLA, PETG and ASA  
  • High Flow  - Perfect if you're looking to push your Voron printer's print speed capabilities to the limit  
  • High Flow X  - All the benefits of the High Flow pack with the bonus of abrasive resistance for printing with fibre filled materials  
  • Genius 400  - A hobbyist’s playground: high temperature, high flow and abrasive printing in one kit
  • Genius Metal  - The ultimate hobbyist’s playground
